bio: The Greek Funding Allocation Board (GFAB), a committee overseen by Fraternity and Sorority Life, facilitates the review and approval of financial allocations for the affiliated organizations overseen by the office. Funding is awarded via the application and review process and is distributed twice a semester each fall and spring.

name: Guide Dogs for the Blind - College Station
bio: Guide Dogs for the Blind provides enhanced mobility to qualified individuals through partnership with dogs whose unique skills are developed and nurtured by dedicated volunteers and a professional staff. Our purpose as a puppy raising student organization is to teach puppies good manners and basic obedience.

name: Guiding Underclassmen In Dental Education
bio: The purpose of the Texas A &M College of Dentistry GUIDE Society is to provide free tutoring sessions led by upperclassmen, designed to help underclassmen enhance their lab work and hand skills by leveraging the experience and expertise of more advanced students.

name: Haas Community Council
bio: The Haas Hall Community Council serves as the representative leadership body for residents of Haas Hall at Texas A&M University. Our mission is to enhance the residential experience by fostering community engagement, organizing programs, and advocating for resident needs.

name: HardChord DynaMix
bio: Our mission is to bring the finest in mixed contemporary a cappella music to Texas A&M University and the surrounding communities.

name: Harmony Aggies Alumni Association
bio: The mission of the Harmony Aggies Alumni Association is to foster a lifelong connection among former students of Harmony Public Schools who attend or have attended Texas A&M University, promote Aggie core values, and support the success of future generations through mentorship, engagement, and service.

name: Hart Community Council
bio: The Hart Hall Community Council represents the residents of Hart Hall at Texas A&M University and operates in coordination with the Residential Housing Association (RHA). Our mission is to foster a spirited, supportive, and engaging environment through programming, peer connection, and student advocacy.

name: Hazards and Disasters Student Association
bio: The Hazards and Disasters Student Association seeks to provide opportunities for students to learn how hazards, disasters, and the changing climate are affecting our communities. We also will be helping communities affected by disasters, engage in community-focused research efforts on the impacts of hazards and disasters, and introduce students to professional careers in hazard mitigation, disaster recovery, and climate resilience.

name: Health Physics Society
bio: The purpose and mission of our student organization, Health Physics Society, is to provide a university-wide community for faculty, staff, students, and alumni interested in supporting and promoting health physics opportunities and careers.

name: Health Policy and Management Association
bio: The mission and purpose of HPMSA is to equip current HPM graduate students with resources and connections to grow their future.

name: Healthy Harvest Community Fridge
bio: The Healthy Harvest Community Fridge is dedicated to fighting food insecurity, reducing waste, and ensuring equitable access to nutritious food. By offering free, rescued groceries to individuals and families in need, we empower our community, enhance well-being, and inspire compassionate, sustainable change.

name: Hearts for the Homeless College Station
bio: Hearts for the Homeless contributes to the health and well-being of one of the most vulnerable populations in our nation with free heart health screenings, education, and by providing clinical outreach opportunities for students who wish to contribute to our effort.

name: HECM Student Affairs
bio: HECM Student Affairs is part of the Higher Education Center at McAllen, Texas A&M University, focusing on student engagement and support.

name: Hellenic Student Association
bio: This organization will henceforth be known as “Hellenic Student Association”. It is centered around Hellenic culture and heritage, and promotes the education of the aforementioned characters to each of its members.

name: Her Campus Texas A&M University
bio: Her Campus at TAMU is a Diamond-level Chapter, which means we are in the top 10% of chapters. Members have the opportunity to write for Her Campus, gain experience in social media, marketing, public relations, and event planning.

name: Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha, Inc
bio: As hermanas of Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha, Inc. our mission is to uphold the goals set forth by our thirteen founding mothers. We vow to formalize, cultivate, and foster bonds amongst each other as sisters and abide by respect, trust, communication, professionalism and accountability.

name: Higher Education Center at McAllen
bio: The Texas A&M University Higher Education Center at McAllen was founded in 2017. As part of Texas A&M University, the Higher Education Center at McAllen is committed to supporting the educational needs of its students by providing top-tier programs to fulfill student career goals, enhancing economic development of the region, and producing a skilled workforce.

name: Hillel Jewish Student Center
bio: Texas A&M Hillel exists to promote religious, cultural, and social interests of the Jewish students at Texas A&M, as well as to foster understanding and friendly relationships with other student organizations on the campus of Texas A&M, in colleges and universities throughout the world, and in the Jewish community.

name: Hindu Students Association
bio: The purpose of the Hindu Students Association is to raise awareness of the Hindu religion and culture while promoting individual spiritual growth. We hold weekly meetings, socials, and a large event each semester celebrating a Hindu festival.

name: Hindu Youth for Unity, Virtue and Action
bio: The mission of Hindu YUVA is to create a space for college students to experience and share in Hindu values, support and organize the Hindu community within Texas A&M and expand a network of individuals from other campuses with whom our students can develop meaningful connections and insights.

name: Hispanic Men in Engineering
bio: Hispanic Men in Engineering (HME) is committed to fostering leadership, community service, and advancing Hispanic culture in STEM. Our mission is to provide representation for Hispanics in engineering, promote professional and social opportunities, and positively impact the Texas A&M University system and the Bryan-College Station community through service and brotherhood.

name: Hispanic Presidents' Council
bio: The Hispanic Presidents' Council (HPC) aims to serve as a means through which all Hispanic students can rise to achieve their full potential as both scholars and leaders in the Texas A&M community. HPC promotes awareness of existing Hispanic organizations and serves as a support group for these organizations.

name: Hispanic Student Dental Association
bio: The purpose of this organization shall be to lead and inspire oral health in the Dallas/ Fort Worth metroplex through education and quality service.

name: HMGT Grad
bio: To ensure and promote the success of past, present, and future HMGT graduate students in the realms of academic pursuit, service to the University and department, and social development.

name: Hobby Community Council
bio: The Hobby Hall Community Council represents the residents of Hobby Hall at Texas A&M University. The council is dedicated to enhancing the residential experience by fostering community engagement, organizing programs, and advocating for resident needs.

name: Honors Housing Community Student Leaders
bio: Honors Programs Peer Leaders provide communication, financial support, and risk management for individuals serving as peer leaders in the Honors Housing Community.

name: Honors Student Council
bio: The Honors Student Council aims to provide quality programming for honors eligible students, represent them within Student Government, and act as a liaison between the Office of Honors Programs and honors students.

name: Horticulture Graduate Council
bio: The Horticulture Graduate Council is an organization which shall foster fellowship among its members, promote scholastic achievement, professionalism, and leadership, and provide service to the Department of Horticultural Sciences, Texas A&M University and the community as a whole.

name: HOSA Texas A&M Higher Education Center At McAllen
bio: The mission of HOSA is to empower future health professionals to become leaders in the global health community through education, collaboration and experience.

name: Hullabaloo Band
bio: The Hullabaloo Band is dedicated to serving as the official university pep band for Texas A&M Volleyball, Men's and Women's Basketball, and Texas A&M Soccer. With over 100 student musicians organized into Maroon and White Bands, we aim to create a vibrant and electrifying game-day atmosphere while maintaining a time commitment friendly to students' academic demands.

name: Hullabaloo Community Council
bio: The Hullabaloo Hall Community Council serves as the leadership body representing the residents of Hullabaloo Hall at Texas A&M University. The council is committed to enhancing the residential experience through student advocacy, programming, and community development.

name: Human Environmental Animal Team
bio: H.E.A.T. is a student service organization dedicated to improving humanitarian, environmental, and animal welfare issues through positive activism. The organization allows members to participate in projects they care about, meet new people, and make a difference.

name: Human Factors and Ergonomics Society
bio: To serve the needs of the human factors profession at Texas A&M University. Its purpose is to promote and advance the understanding of the human factors involved in the design, manufacture, and use of machines, systems, environments and devices of all kinds through the interchange of knowledge and methods in the behavioral, biological, and physical sciences and in industrial, computer science and other relevant engineering disciplines.

name: IEEE Microwave Theory and Technology Society at Texas A&M University
bio: To facilitate an environment that helps students expand their knowledge of microwave and radio frequency theory, learn applicable skills related to microwave and radio frequency engineering, and grow as student leaders.

name: IEEE-Power Engineering Society-Industry Application Society-Power Electronics Society Joint Student Chapter
bio: The purposes of the Society are technical, scientific, literary, and educational. The Society shall strive for the advancement of knowledge of the theory and practice of electrical engineering and the related arts and sciences.

name: IEEE-Tech Electrical and Electronics Engineers
bio: The purpose shall be to disseminate knowledge of the theory and practice of all aspects of electrical engineering, electronics, radio, allied branches of engineering or the related arts and sciences, as well as to further the professional development of its members.

name: Immigration Initiative
bio: The purpose of the Immigration Law Initiative (ILI) is to promote and advance the immigration law field. To fulfill the mission statement it is essential to serve the local community and the public at large through education on the immigration system and community service.

name: The Impact Movement
bio: The Impact Movement equips Black students to become disciples of Jesus Christ who integrate their faith into every aspect of their life.

name: Indian Graduate Students Association
bio: Our purpose is to serve Indian graduate students (alumni, current, & incoming) and their families at Texas A&M University. We are an organization in the service of over 800 Indian graduate students on-campus at Texas A&M University.

name: Indian Orthodox Campus Ministry
bio: Our mission is to provide Indian Orthodox Christians an avenue to grow in their faith away from home.

name: Indonesian Students Association
bio: We, the Indonesian students who reside in the United States, are responsible to promote Indonesia's culture and ethnic diversity and to build unity and fellowship among Indonesian students in the United States, specifically in the Bryan and College Station area.

name: Infantry Band
bio: Infantry Band is dedicated to developing members of the Fightin' Texas Aggie Band and instilling in them the importance of enduring habits of excellence. The battalion will focus above all on returning cadets to the world more decisive, mindful, and confident than they were when they joined.

name: INFORMS Student Chapter at Texas A&M
bio: Encourage interest in the field of Operations Research (OR) and the Management Sciences (MS), provide means of communication and networking among people having interest in OR/MS, provide an informal mean of exchange about OR/MS, educational programs and opportunities.

name: Ingeniare Chorus and Symphony
bio: Ingeniare Chorus and Symphony is a community of musicians who meet to learn music, foster music appreciation, and bring the joy of music to others at Texas A&M and the greater community through performance.

name: INMM A&M Chapter
bio: INMM is an international organization that is dedicated to improving the management of nuclear related materials. The INMM student chapter at TAMU provides support for those engaged in nuclear materials management and safeguards through meetings and professional contacts.

name: Insightful Connections
bio: Insightful Connections (IC) promotes awareness about how people with visual impairments can live without limits. IC provides opportunities for visually impaired and sighted individuals to participate in service activities; to advocate for accessibility; and to educate the local community.

name: Institute for Healthcare Improvement Open School of Health Professions (Texas A&M University, School of Public Health)
bio: The mission and purpose of this organization is to advance the understanding and commitment of the next generation of health professionals to patient safety and quality improvement in health care locally, nationally, and globally.

name: Institute for the Development and Education of Asian American Leaders
bio: Institute for Development and Education for Asian American Leaders (IDEAAL) was created in September 2003 as a portal to guide Asian American Aggies on the road to becoming strong influences in the Aggie Community. IDEAAL is a student institute and organization assisting in the development of Asian American students, through leadership, support network, and sense of cultural identity.

name: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, Inc.
bio: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) is the world's largest professional organization for advancing technology. Our mission as the Texas A&M Student Branch is to prepare students for careers in technology.

name: Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers
bio: The purpose of this Chapter is to serve as a voice of the Industrial and Systems Engineering Students, provide programs to enhance the knowledge and understanding of the profession, promote Industrial and Systems Engineering in public relations, promote professional consciousness and fellowship, and allow students to form a network among students, professors, and companies for their futures.

name: Institute of Transportation Engineers
bio: The purpose of this organization shall be to promote the advancement of transportation engineering. The goals of this organization shall be to foster the closer association of students with the transportation profession and the Institute of Transportation Engineers (ITE), to promote the development of professional spirit, and to identify and address common transportation interests among the student members.

name: Intellectual Property Aggies
bio: The mission and purpose of Intellectual Property Aggies (IPA) is to facilitate relationships between students interested in intellectual property law, the intellectual property law faculty and staff, and members of the community such as practicing attorneys. Intellectual Property Aggies will also promote activities to educate students about intellectual property law.

name: Interfraternity Council
bio: IFC exists as a resource to facilitate the growth and development of fraternity men in the areas of fraternal responsibility, leadership, civic engagement, and brotherhood among the member chapters.

name: Internal Audit Program - Student Association
bio: The IAPSA is to provide undergraduate and graduate students with an educational and social organization that promotes internal auditing as a career objective.

name: International Business Association
bio: IBA is an open and inclusive organization that develops students into globally literate persons possessing the ability to communicate and do business around the globe.

name: International Council on Systems Engineering
bio: The mission of INCOSE at Texas A&M is to facilitate the development of Systems Engineers through educational assistance, networking opportunities, ASEP certification assistance and leadership opportunities.

name: International Development and Economics Association
bio: The mission of IDEA is to engage students in the most pressing economic challenges confronting the United States and world economies by distributing policy-relevant research; hosting and participating in educational sessions; and engaging stakeholders in the areas of trade, economics, and public policy.

name: International Institute for Culture and Performing Arts Development
bio: To erase cultural and ethnic barriers by promoting and preserving the diverse cultural and performing arts heritage of Texas A&M faculties, staff and students. To form successful partnerships with academic departments and student organizations in order to organize multicultural events, seminars and workshops on and off campus.

name: International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering
bio: The mission of the organization is "Connecting students to Industry". The purpose of this organization is to help students learn more about and network with professionals in the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry around Texas and nationally.

name: International Student Association
bio: The mission of the International Student Association at Texas A&M University is to promote cultural awareness and diversity on campus and in the community, advocate for the general welfare of the international student body, and provide opportunities for the development of global leadership skills in its members.

name: International Student Mentors Association
bio: The International Student Mentors Association (ISMA) is a student organization at Texas A&M that pairs international students with current Aggies to build friendships and ease the transition to life in the United States. Mentors help guide and support international students, while mentees gain opportunities to learn about American culture and connect with a supportive community.

name: Ismaili Muslim Student Association
bio: To serve to promote unity and a sense of belonging among Ismaili Muslim students. To encourage members to engage in service, social, health and fitness, and professional development activities while embracing pluralism and maintaining the ethics and values of the Ismaili faith.

name: ISPOR Student Chapter at TAMU
bio: The ISPOR Student Chapter at Texas A&M University provides an environment for students to share knowledge in pharmacoeconomics and health outcomes research, bridging students with the pharmaceutical industry and academia.

name: Japanese Culture Association
bio: We are committed to helping students learn and practice Japanese as well as teach students about the culture of Japan during our meetings and events. We also provide a way for native Japanese speakers to meet with each other and feel more welcome to Texas A&M University.

name: Jewish Law Students Association
bio: To establish an inclusive Jewish community at Texas A&M School of Law.

name: John Quincy Adams Society
bio: The John Quincy Adams Society (JQAS) is a national network of student groups committed to identifying, educating, and equipping the next generation of scholars and policy leaders to encourage a new era of realism and restraint in American foreign policy.

name: Journal of Law & Civil Governance at Texas A&M
bio: The Texas A&M Journal of Law & Civil Governance is a forum for the rigorous debate and discussion of leading policy issues. The Journal seeks to explore the intersection between the law, government, and the flourishing of civil society.

name: Juventutem
bio: Juventutem seeks to promote the traditional teachings and practices of the Roman Catholic Church amongst Texas A&M students, lobby for the Traditional Latin Mass in Bryan-College Station, sanctify the youth, and spread the Catholic Faith.

name: K-pop Dance Association
bio: To spread Korean culture through dance and performance.

name: Kanakuk Ags
bio: The purpose of Kanakuk Ags is to provide an opportunity for Kanakuk/KAA Kamp's summer staff to be able to fellowship together here at Texas A&M University based on the fellowship of the body of Christ. Also, Kanakuk Ags will organize activities during each semester and support any other Kanakuk/KAA ministries that come to Texas A&M.

name: KANM
bio: KANM Student Radio is where Texas A&M students come together to share their voices, their music, and their stories. As a student organization, we’re all about celebrating creativity and individuality, giving Aggies a platform to showcase their unique perspectives.

name: Kappa Alpha Order
bio: Our goal as a chapter is to act as a moral compass for the modern gentleman. We strive to enlighten young men on the significance of integrity, gentlemanly conduct, and honorable character.

name: Kappa Alpha Psi
bio: Kappa Alpha Psi aims to unite college men of culture, patriotism, and honor in a bond of Fraternity, encourage honorable achievement in every field of human endeavor, and promote the spiritual, social, intellectual, and moral welfare of its members.

name: Kappa Alpha Theta
bio: Kappa Alpha Theta promotes the social, intellectual, and moral growth of college women.

name: Kappa Delta
bio: The purpose of Kappa Delta Sorority is to promote true friendship among the college girls of our country by inculcating into their hearts and lives those principles of truth, of honor, of duty, without which there can be no true friendship.

name: Kappa Delta Chi
bio: Kappa Delta Chi promotes development of character through participating in community service, leadership, scholarship, and sisterhood building activities.

name: Kappa Kappa Gamma
bio: Kappa Kappa Gamma is an organization of women, which seeks for every member throughout her life bonds of friendship, mutual support, opportunities for self-growth, respect for intellectual development, and an understanding of and allegiance to positive ethical principles.

name: Kappa Phi Beta Christian Sisterhood
bio: Kappa Phi Christian Sisterhood is a Christ-centered organization for college women. It provides an opportunity for, and challenges them to grow in their knowledge and understanding of Christ, to be a loving community and provide fellowship to fellow sisters, and to be personally involved, active participants in our Church, school, and community.

name: Kappa Sigma
bio: The Kappa Sigma Fraternity, founded in 1982 at Texas A&M University, aims to create better men through the pillars of Fellowship, Leadership, Scholarship, and Service. With over 200 chapters and colonies, it has a strong presence and a mission to uphold its traditions and values.

name: Kappa Theta Beta
bio: As a sisterhood of Catholic women growing together in holiness, Kappa Theta Beta exists to encounter Christ in prayer, serve the community, and foster fellowship.

name: Kappa Upsilon Chi
bio: KYX exists to glorify Jesus Christ, uphold Biblical Christian standards, influence the community through service, and help others strengthen their academic achievement.

name: KARURA, Mars Rover Project
bio: Building a Mars Rover for University Rover Challenge with students from foreign countries.

name: Kevin Carreathers Leadership Institute
bio: The purpose of KCLI is to provide a two-year leadership development, skills training, and mentorship program for incoming freshmen at Texas A&M University.

name: Korean Aggies Badminton Club
bio: The Korean Aggies Badminton Club was founded in 2018 at Texas A&M University to promote fun and health through badminton. Members can practice with coaches to improve their skills.

name: Korean-American Scientists and Engineers Association
bio: To promote friendship among Korean and Korean-American students in science, engineering, and related fields, to help develop their full career potential in their respective areas, to foster the international leaders for the cooperation between the USA and Korea, and to promote the application of science and technology for the general welfare of society.

name: Lambda Chi Alpha
bio: Lambda Chi Alpha is one of the largest men's fraternities in North America, with more than 280,000 members and chapters at 195 Universities across North America. At Texas A&M, we are proud to be one of the fastest-growing and most active chapters on campus.

name: Lambda Delta Psi Sorority
bio: Lambda Delta Psi Sorority is an Asian American interest sorority founded at the University of Oklahoma. Our purpose is to cultivate a sisterhood of distinguished women through friendship and service while maintaining high moral and academic standards.

name: Lambda Pi Eta
bio: Lambda Pi Eta recognizes, fosters, and rewards outstanding scholastic achievement in communication, telecommunication, and media studies; stimulates interest in the broad field of communication; promotes professional development among undergraduates; provides opportunities to discuss and exchange ideas; and explores options for graduate education.

name: Lambda Theta Alpha
bio: Lambda Theta Alpha is the first Latina Sorority founded in the United States, established to empower women through unity, love, and respect while promoting scholarly excellence, cultural awareness, and community activism.

name: Latino Aggie Mentorship Program
bio: The mission of the Latino Aggie Mentorship Program is to create a positive environment that will foster a sense of belonging by serving as a place to engage and create meaningful lasting friendships with other people from similar backgrounds as they navigate the uncharted field of college and the pre-health journey.

name: Latino Logradores
bio: Latino Logradores (LatiLo) is a freshman program that supports the success of Latino/a/x students at Texas A&M University by providing mentorship, a family atmosphere, aid with the transition from high school to college, and resources to help students thrive.

name: Latino Males United
bio: To create a space which allows Latino males a healthy environment to express relevant issues surrounding their specific community and assists in their holistic development and support at Texas A&M University.

name: Latino Medical Student Association
bio: The Latino Medical Student Association unites and empowers medical students through service, mentorship and education to advocate for the health of the Latino community.

name: Latino Medical Student Association Pre-med Latino Undergraduate Society
bio: The Latino Medical Student Association - Pre-Medical Latino Undergraduate Society unites and empowers medical students through service, mentorship and education to advocate for the health of the Latino community. Our vision is to unify Pre-Medical Students to promote Latino health.

name: Latinx Graduate Student Association
bio: The LGSA is an educational organization committed to the recruitment and retention, and the academic/professional development of Latinx graduate students, as well as to the solicitation of support to foster a nurturing environment for Latino/a graduate students at Texas A&M.

name: Latinx Graduation Coalition
bio: Our mission is to spread the values of inclusivity and diversity throughout Texas A&M University by celebrating the accomplishments of our Aggies in Spanish and English through planning the Latinx Graduation Ceremony every Fall and Spring Semester.

name: Latinx Law Student Association
bio: LLSA is every Latina/o law student's connection to the larger Latina/o legal community. We strive to be the leading center for student resources, dialogue and action.

name: Latinx Veterinary Medical Association Student Chapter
bio: The LVMA's mission is to empower Latinx professionals in the veterinary field and to support the next generation of Latinx veterinarians.

name: Latter-day Saint Student Association
bio: To encourage and support members of LDSSA in achieving their academic goals and maintaining a balanced life while on campus. To encourage members of LDSSA to become an influence for good by participating in activities and service on campus and in the community.

name: Law Fellowship
bio: The Texas A&M Public Interest Law Fellowship is a student-run organization devoted to raising awareness of legal work in the public interest sector. The fellowship program funds internships for deserving law school students performing public interest law work during the summer to provide crucial legal services to those in need.

name: League of United Latin American Citizens Council 22424
bio: The Mission of the League of United Latin American Citizens is to advance the economic condition, educational attainment, housing, health, and civil rights of the Hispanic population of Texas A&M University, its surrounding communities, and the greater United States as a whole.

name: Lechner-McFadden Community Council
bio: The Lechner-McFadden Community Council represents the residents of Lechner and McFadden Halls at Texas A&M University and functions as a leadership organization within the Residential Housing Association (RHA). Our mission is to build an active, fun, and intellectually engaging residential community through leadership, programming, and advocacy.

name: Legett Community Council
bio: The Legett Hall Community Council represents the residents of Leggett Hall at Texas A&M University and operates under the support and guidance of the Residential Housing Association (RHA). As a student-led leadership body, the council is committed to enhancing the residential experience through programming, student advocacy, and community engagement.

name: LEGION
bio: LEGION is a men's organization at Texas A&M University aimed at developing Aggie men into strong leaders while emphasizing respect, service, and Texas A&M traditions.

name: LEIAS
bio: The purpose of LEIAS is to provide members with an enriched college experience filled with activities of selfless service, sisterhood, and Aggie traditions. LEIAS builds character traits that every Aggie should embody, develops leadership qualities for individuals in college and in the workforce, and promotes life-long interpersonal relationships.

name: Appelt Community Council
bio: The Appelt Hall Community Council represents the residents of Appelt Hall at Texas A&M University. Operating under the guidance of the Residential Housing Association (RHA), the council is dedicated to enhancing the residential experience by fostering community engagement, organizing programs, and advocating for resident needs.

name: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer Aggies
bio: The purposes of LGBTQA are threefold: to provide support for all lesbians, gays, bisexuals, transgender, and queer individuals within the University and surrounding communities; to provide educational information on historical and current issues regarding lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer individuals; and to create opportunities for welcoming, safe, and supportive social gatherings.

name: LIGHT
bio: The purposes of this organization shall be to bring together a multicultural group of students working toward the common goal of community service, create awareness among students of community outreach opportunities, promote participation in service activities, encourage a collegial bond among students, residents, faculty, and staff, and enhance the reputation of the dental school.

name: Lilies
bio: The mission of Aggie Lilies is to promote an environment which fosters genuine friendships among the women of Texas A&M University and encourages each member to be their truest and best selves. Through our Philanthropy of service to the First Responders in the Bryan-College Station area, we strive to build up the women of Lilies to continue a spirit of compassion throughout their lives.

name: LoveWorld Texas A&M University
bio: We believe in building a happier world through love and following the example of our Lord Jesus Christ - who is the ultimate expression of love.

name: Lutheran Student Fellowship
bio: Lutheran Student Fellowship (LSF) is a vibrant, recognized student organization at Texas A&M University. We’re a welcoming Christian community focused on leadership growth, meaningful outreach, and building genuine relationships.

name: MAES: Latinos in Science and Engineering, Texas A&M University Chapter
bio: The purpose of the MAES: Latinos in Science and Engineering is to promote the professional and personal development of minorities pursuing degrees in engineering and science. We encourage the involvement of minorities in higher education, as well as provide academic assistance and growth opportunities in the STEM industry.

name: Maggies
bio: Maggies is an organization formed to unite a diverse group of primarily women student leaders. Through service, networking, leadership development, and the promotion of Aggie Spirit and traditions, we will enhance our college experience and give back to the community.

name: Major General T. G. Darling Recruiting Company
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Corps of Cadets Major General T. G. Darling Recruiting Company is to provide well-trained and highly motivated cadets to support Corps of Cadets recruiting events.

name: Maroon Health
bio: To connect School of Medicine students in Houston to volunteering opportunities in health education at Open Gate Homeless Ministries and in the Houston area broadly.

name: Maroon Life
bio: Provide a look behind the maroon curtain through dynamic content and equip our students with the skills and passion to set them apart in their careers and in life. Provide dynamic stories and an engaging visual look into the Texas A&M campus and community.

name: Maroon Out
bio: Since 1998, Maroon Out has united former, current, and future Aggies in a shared display of school spirit, selling over 50,000 Maroon Out shirts each year. This student-led organization isn’t just about creating a sea of maroon at annual games—it’s about fostering unity and giving back to the Aggie community.

name: Maroon Prestige
bio: The Maroon Prestige Dance Team is committed to representing Texas A&M with the highest caliber of school spirit, personal integrity, and dance talent through their high standards of excellence and tradition of teamwork. The overall mission is to uplift and unite our community through music and morale.

name: Maroon Steel
bio: Maroon Steel is a steelpan ensemble that enhances music appreciation and performance while encouraging collaboration, inclusion, and leadership. The group promotes a greater understanding of the history and culture of the African diaspora as it pertains to the Caribbean.

name: Materials Advantage
bio: To provide students studying (and/or interested in) the field of materials science and engineering opportunities to further their professional development, technical laboratory skills, social presentation skills, and professional and recreational networks.

name: Materials Science and Engineering Ambassadors
bio: The purpose and mission of this organization is to promote the Department of Materials Science and Engineering (MSEN) through tours, demonstrations, and discussions.

name: Maternal and Child Border Health Organization
bio: The Maternal and Child Border Health Organization (MCBHO) is dedicated to advancing advocacy and support for maternal and child health within border communities. The organization fosters interdisciplinary collaboration, advocacy, and community service initiatives that promote maternal and child health in the border region.

name: Mays MBA Association
bio: Serve as a liaison amongst the MBA classes, programs, peers, and former students, enriching the MBA experience inside and outside the classroom by building a community of learning and camaraderie.

name: McAllen Aggie Baptist Student Ministry (BSM)
bio: To study and share the word of God and message of Jesus Christ.

name: McAllen Aggies All In
bio: The purpose is to aim at serving others and the community throughout the Rio Grande Valley, providing the highest level of compassion and service while fulfilling duties as a valued volunteer member.

name: McAllen Agricultural Economics Club
bio: The McAllen Agricultural Economics Club is a recognized student organization focused on developing students into industry leaders. We provide students interested in agricultural economics and related fields a platform to collaborate and network.

name: MD Plus Student Organization
bio: Our mission is to empower and unite MD+ students at Texas A&M Naresh K. Vishisht College of Medicine by providing resources, fostering camaraderie, and organizing educational and social events.

name: Mechanical Engineering Female Grad Students
bio: Our organization aims at performing outreach activities and providing a supportive and collaborative community among the female graduate students in the Mechanical Engineering department, mentoring female students through their graduate studies, and motivating and encouraging female graduate students to pursue a career in academia/industry.

name: Mechanical Engineering Graduate Student Organization
bio: The purpose is to promote positive communication within the Mechanical Engineering Graduate Program at Texas A&M University through regular member meetings, social activities, knowledge exchange and contact with the ME faculty.

name: Medical Ethics at A&M
bio: Medical Ethics at A&M (MEAM) envisions a campus community where students are actively engaged in ethical discourse, socially responsible service, and advocacy for equitable healthcare. This can be accomplished through education, outreach, and upholding an ethical responsibility in advancing healthcare.

name: Medical Group Management Association
bio: The Medical Group Management Association (MGMA) student chapter was established in 2002 to promote professionalism, networking, leadership, and learning among its members. All concentrations are encouraged to become active participants of MGMA.

name: Medical Journaling at A&M
bio: As a medical journal club, our goal is to support fellow premedical students in their journey through supplemental education by using medical literature and by utilizing skills based in scientific research needed for a career in healthcare.

name: Medical Students for Choice
bio: Expose and educate medical students to the practice of reproductive healthcare and family planning in the state of Texas. Provide opportunities for medical students to learn from leaders in the field and facilitate discussion within our student community. MSFC aims to foster open discussion of contraception and reproductive health choices.

name: MEDLIFE
bio: MEDLIFE's mission is to build a worldwide Movement empowering low income families in their fight for equal access to healthcare, education, and a safe home. We partner with low-income communities in Latin America and Africa to improve their access to medicine, education, and community development projects.

name: Memorial Student Center Council
bio: The Memorial Student Center (MSC) Council is a recognized student organization at Texas A&M University. With a longstanding tradition of student-led programming, the MSC Council has supported 75 generations of Aggies in developing as individuals, leaders, and engaged members of the community.

name: Memorial Student Center Programs
bio: As a department in the Division of Student Affairs, Memorial Student Center (MSC) Programs promotes leadership development and experiential learning opportunities through academic, entertainment, social, arts, political and cultural awareness campus programs and service opportunities while preparing students to engage in a global society.

name: Men in Nursing
bio: The purpose and mission of our student organization, Men in Nursing, is to recruit Aggies who are interested in the nursing profession and provide a framework for Aggie nursing students and faculty members within the Texas A&M University - College of Nursing to collaborate and discuss positive differences between men and women who shape practice, education, research, and leadership to humanize healthcare.

name: Men's Club Basketball
bio: To provide an opportunity for Texas A&M students to compete in basketball against other schools around the nation at a high level.

name: Men's Lacrosse Team of Texas A&M University
bio: To promote the sport of lacrosse at Texas A&M University and to compete on a national level.

name: Men's Volleyball
bio: Texas A&M Men's Volleyball diligently works on the court and in the classroom to provide a competitive volleyball experience. As a student-run organization, we fundraise to travel and compete on the national level.

name: Mens Waterpolo
bio: The Men’s Water Polo club trains students to compete on a state and national scale, focusing on swimming, agility, ball sense, and ball handling.

name: Mentorship in Ocean Engineering
bio: To create an environment in which undergraduate Ocean Engineers can develop their professional network, excel academically, and become part of a community from the moment they are accepted into the program to the time they graduate.

name: Mexican Student Association
bio: Since 1975, the Mexican Student Association has proudly served as 'A Home Away From Home' for Latinx Aggies! We provide Texas A&M Latinx students with opportunities to embrace and celebrate their rich cultural heritage through cultural events, sports, social gatherings, service opportunities, and more.

name: Militia of the Immaculata
bio: The purpose of the MI consists of collaborating in the conversion and sanctification of all, thus obtaining the greatest glory of the Most Holy and Undivided Trinity. MI members live their own baptismal consecration by welcoming the gift of the Redeemer from the Cross.

name: Minorities in Agriculture, Natural Resources and Related Sciences
bio: The purpose of MANRRS is to increase the number of students from underrepresented backgrounds studying agriculture and related fields at undergraduate and graduate levels, develop leadership, communication, and professional skills in students, foster a bond of fellowship among students, faculty, staff, and administrators in the college, and promote career and academic counseling for undergraduate and graduate students.

name: Minority Association of Pre-Health and Pre-Medical
bio: The overall goal of the Minority Association of Pre-Health and Pre-Medical Students is to increase the amount of minorities in medical and other health related professional schools. The organization aims to allow its members an opportunity to have one-on-one interactions with students from the Texas A&M Schools of Medicine, Nursing, and Dentistry.

name: MIS Buddy Connect
bio: The objective of this organization is to serve the incoming batch of students of the MS-MIS Graduate program at Mays Business School. This is to be done by enabling them to transition to the graduate program smoothly by sharing of our experience and helping them get acclimatized to the graduate culture.

name: MORPH
bio: MORPH is a student organization at Texas A&M University dedicated to growing our members through services for those in the foster care community. We work hand in hand with organizations such as Brazos Valley CASA - Voices for Children, BCS Together, and John's Boys to provide care and support for foster children and families within our reach.

name: Moses Community Council
bio: The Moses Hall Community Council serves as the governing student leadership body for the residents of Moses Hall at Texas A&M University. The council is committed to enhancing the residential experience through student representation, programming, and the promotion of hall community and engagement.

name: Mosher Community Council
bio: The Mosher Hall Community Council represents the residents of Mosher Hall at Texas A&M University. Operating under the guidance of the Residential Housing Association (RHA), the council is dedicated to enhancing the residential experience by fostering community engagement, organizing programs, and advocating for resident needs.

name: MOVE Texas A&M
bio: MOVE is a nonpartisan, nonprofit, grassroots organization building power in underrepresented youth communities through civic education, leadership development, and issue advocacy. Here at our Texas A&M chapter, we seek to spread voter rights awareness and increase voter registration among the Texas A&M community.

name: MSC Abbott Family Leadership Conference
bio: The MSC Abbott Family Leadership Conference selects around 60 Aggie sophomores and juniors as conference delegates. The goal of the MSC Abbott Family Leadership Conference is to encourage delegates to study and reflect on their individual ethics, morals, and values, establishing a personal value system and apply it to their lives as student leaders at Texas A&M and in future business, community, and family relationships.

name: MSC Aggie Cinema
bio: MSC Aggie Cinema is a student organization within the Memorial Student Center. The committee aims to engage Texas A&M students by producing year-round entertaining, cultural, and educational programs that bring the best of cinema through our Blockbuster, Arthouse, Classic Series, Advanced Screenings, and other special events.

name: MSC Aggie Leaders of Tomorrow
bio: MSC Aggie Leaders of Tomorrow is a freshman leadership organization that provides programs and service opportunities that foster leadership and personal growth for students at Texas A&M.

name: MSC Assessments
bio: The MSC Assessments team helps other committees improve their events through data analytics. The Assessments team reviews post-event evaluations and assesses the strengths and weaknesses in various areas for MSC committees to review for future events.

name: MSC Brown-Smith United Kingdom International Honors Leadership Program
bio: The Craig Brown ’75 and Sue Smith International Leadership Program in the United Kingdom presents an outstanding personal development opportunity for incoming Brown Scholars. The Program provides a two-week summer educational experience in Scotland and England, with focus on leadership development and team building with other Brown Scholars.

name: MSC Committee for the Awareness of Mexican-American Culture
bio: Founded in 1974, MSC Committee for the Awareness of Mexican-American Culture (MSC CAMAC) is a student organization that focuses on uniting students from diverse backgrounds to establish an appreciation for various Hispanic and Latinx cultures on the Texas A&M campus and in the Bryan/College Station community.

name: MSC Conway-Fitzhugh International Honors Leadership Seminar
bio: The MSC Conway-Fitzhugh International Honors Leadership Seminar was established in 1992 to offer students opportunities for personal and academic growth through international travel and history.

name: MSC Fall Leadership Conference
bio: The Memorial Student Center Annual Fall Leadership Conference is a highly anticipated conference tailored to provide student leaders an opportunity to network and further develop leadership skills - the Aggie Way.

name: MSC Freshman Leadership International
bio: MSC Freshman Leadership International is a freshman leadership organization at Texas A&M University where international passion meets leadership development and selfless service.

name: MSC Freshmen in Service and Hosting
bio: Memorial Student Center Freshmen in Service and Hosting provides leadership opportunities aimed at enhancing its members' purpose and identity by engaging in community service and program development on campus and within the community.

name: MSC Hospitality
bio: MSC Hospitality, the Official Host Committee of the Memorial Student Center, produces programs that cultivate community around the living room of campus and serves as an ambassador organization for the university community.

name: MSC J. Wayne Stark Northeast Tour
bio: The MSC Stark Northeast Tour provides students the opportunity to visit top schools and cities in the U.S., focusing on public service, history, arts, and culture while expanding their personal networks.

name: MSC L.T. Jordan Institute for International Awareness
bio: The MSC L.T. and Jessie W. Jordan Institute serves as a catalyst for international engagement, providing resources and initiatives that enhance the global competencies of the Texas A&M community. Through partnerships, scholarships, and immersive experiences abroad, we aim to inspire a deep appreciation for diverse cultures and perspectives.

name: MSC OPAS Student Committee
bio: The MSC OPAS Student Committee is a service organization that helps bring the performing arts to the students of Texas A&M University and the residents of the Brazos Valley. Each season we assist OPAS in presenting professional productions on the stages of the Rudder Theatre Complex.

name: MSC Spencer Leadership Conference
bio: MSC Spencer Leadership Conference provides programs in leadership training and values development through exposing prospective student leaders to leaders in business, industry, education, innovation, inclusion, and public service.

name: MSC Student Conference on National Affairs
bio: The MSC Student Conference On National Affairs, or MSC SCONA, is the oldest student organization in the Memorial Student Center at Texas A &M University in College Station. The SCONA Conference features notable national security speakers and roundtables on issues the United States is facing.

name: MSC Town Hall
bio: Since 1951, MSC Town Hall has presented a variety of live music and entertainment programs to the Texas A&M University community. We are responsible for programming between 20 and 30 events every academic school year.

name: MSC Visual Arts Committee
bio: The MSC Visual Arts Committee engages the Texas A&M community in the visual arts through programs including gallery exhibitions, lectures, residencies, competitions, workshops, and other visual arts programs.

name: MSC Wiley Lecture Series
bio: The MSC Wiley Lecture Series broadens the educational experiences of the Texas A&M community by providing thought-provoking programming on national and foreign policy issues. The series provides Texas A&M students with opportunities to complement their classroom education by allowing them to directly interact with the men and women who influence the world.

name: MSC Woodson Black Awareness Committee
bio: The MSC Woodson Black Awareness Committee (MSC WBAC) enhances the understanding of the culture, contributions, and impact on society of people of African descent by providing educational and community-building programs and experiences for the Texas A&M University communities.

name: The Mugdown
bio: The Mugdown exists to challenge the thinking of the A&M community by delivering relevant satirical news.

name: Multicultural Association of Business Students
bio: The Texas A&M Multicultural Association of Business Students aims to create opportunities for students to develop as culturally competent leaders, establish a stronger presence of underrepresented populations at Mays Business School, and provide corporations access to the multicultural population during networking events.

name: Multicultural Greek Council
bio: To create and maintain high standards in the life of fraternities and sororities by addressing, coordinating and developing strategic plans; to unify organizations, promote higher education, provide community services, enhance leadership, and serve as a liaison between the MGC, the University student body, and administration, thereby improving the campus climate.

name: Music Activities
bio: The Department of Music Activities provides opportunities to student musicians to perform on local, national and international platforms.

name: Muslim Student Dental Association
bio: The purpose of this organization will be to promote unity among Muslim students at Texas A&M School of Dentistry, provide a space for non-Muslims to learn about Islam, present information about religion and culture at events like the Culture Fest, and organize service events such as health fairs at local mosques.

name: Muslim Students' Association
bio: The purpose of the MSA will be to serve the best interest of Islam and Muslims of Texas A&M University. The MSA shall promote unity and joint action among the Muslims, conduct religious, social, cultural and other activities in the best traditions of Islam, and present Islam to Muslims and non-Muslims.

name: NAACP
bio: Our mission is to achieve equity, political rights, and social inclusion by advancing policies and practices that expand human and civil rights, eliminate discrimination, and accelerate the well-being, education, and economic security of Black people and all persons of color.

name: National Agri-Marketing Association
bio: Texas A&M National Agri-Marketing Association chapter helps tomorrow's agri-marketing leaders build leadership skills and develop professional networks. Many Student NAMA members stay engaged and continue as members of their local NAMA Chapter as they launch their careers in agri-marketing.

name: National Association for Catering and Events, Bryan- College Station Students
bio: The NACE Student Organization is a student group affiliated with the National Association of Catering and Events and the Professional Conference Management Association, providing opportunities for students interested in event planning to learn new skills, network with industry professionals, and access event-related scholarships.

name: National Association of Environmental Professionals
bio: Our mission is to prepare Texas A&M students for professions in the environmental field. We are a multidisciplinary organization, open to all majors, dedicated to the promotion of green jobs, professionalism, and academic excellence.

name: National Association of Hispanic Journalists
bio: The National Association of Hispanic Journalists is a national and student chapter at Texas A&M as well as a student organization. This organization focuses on amplifying Hispanic voices in the journalism industry.

name: National Association of Home Builders
bio: To participate for the purpose of mutual benefit in an interchange of information and experience with the National Association of Home Builders of the United States and appropriate local and state NHAB affiliated associations. This chapter shall operate for the benefit of students in light construction curriculum and those engaged in allied curricula on the chapter's campus.

name: National Association of Minority Landscape Architects – Texas A&M University Student Chapter
bio: The organization will serve current students that are pursuing a Bachelor's in Landscape Architecture and a Master's in Landscape Architecture. However, any student from any department is allowed to join.

name: National Organization of Minority Architecture Students - Texas A&M University Chapter
bio: Texas A&M Student Chapter (NOMAS) of the National Organization of Minority Architects (NOMA) aims to support minority architecture students through networking, mentorship, and professional development.

name: National Pan-Hellenic Council
bio: To promote the development of character for our members through participation in community service, leadership, scholarship, and brother/sisterhood building activities. To serve as the governing body for historical Black fraternities and sororities at Texas A&M University.

name: National Residence Hall Honorary
bio: NRHH is the premier honor society for student leaders living on campus, spotlighting those who make life better in the halls through kindness, leadership, initiative, and integrity.

name: National Society of Black Engineers
bio: The mission of the National Society of Black Engineers is to increase the number of culturally responsible black engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community.

name: National Society of Collegiate Scholars at TAMU
bio: The purposes of the organization are to recognize and celebrate high achievement among first and second year students in all academic disciplines, to encourage and promote high standards throughout the collegiate experience, to provide opportunities for personal growth and leadership development for members, to organize and encourage learning opportunities through community service, and to foster an overall appreciation for the value of the higher education experience.

name: The National Society of Leadership and Success
bio: The National Society of Leadership and Success (NSLS) is the nation’s largest accredited leadership honor society, with over 1.5 million members and more than 700 chapters nationwide. At Texas A&M University, our chapter is proud to be part of this mission—developing strong, service-minded leaders who live out the Aggie Core Values both on campus and in the community.

name: Native American and Indigenous Student Organization
bio: The purpose of the organization shall be to promote the unity and cultures of Native American and Indigenous people throughout the university and the community.

name: Naval ROTC Midshipmen Battalion
bio: To enhance the character and competence of future leaders for the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps.

name: NCNW
bio: The purpose of the TEXAS A &M UNIVERSITY COLLEGIATE SECTION is to promote and support the national programs of the NCNW in the College Station and Bryan Texas community and metropolitan area.

name: Neeley Community Council
bio: The Neeley Hall Community Council serves as the representative student leadership body for residents of Neeley Hall at Texas A&M University, committed to enhancing the residential experience through student advocacy, collaborative programming, and the promotion of a strong hall community.

name: Nepalese Student Association
bio: The organization aims to function as a platform for sharing Nepalese culture and tradition with other students while simultaneously introducing newly arrived Nepalese students to American culture. It also strives to provide assistance to new Nepalese students by offering housing advice, transportation, and addressing other immediate needs upon their arrival.

name: New Student Conferences
bio: New Student & Family Programs is here to support your success as a new student, from the time of admission through your first year at Texas A&M. We also strive to be a partner to family members, by serving as a one-stop resource for Aggie Parents & Families.

name: Next-Gen Aggies
bio: Our purpose is to serve as an organizing force and support system for first-generation law students within the law school as they tackle law school and the legal profession. Our four main approaches are: Academic Orientation, Professional Development, Social & Emotional Support, and Financial Empowerment.

name: NMDP Chapter of Texas A&M
bio: The mission of NMDP at Texas A&M University is to help find cures and save lives for patients with blood cancers and disorders. We raise awareness, recruit potential blood stem cell and bone marrow donors, and fundraise to directly support patients and donors.

name: Nurses Christian Fellowship
bio: Nurses Christian Fellowship exists to equip, encourage, and empower nursing students in the context of nursing school. The purpose is to establish and advance witnessing communities of nursing students and nurses who follow Jesus as Savior and Lord.

name: Nutrition Honors Association
bio: The mission of the NHA is to support current students in Nutrition Sciences Honors Program via fundraising and social events as well as engage nutrition students in serving the community.

name: Occupational Therapy Society
bio: To educate students and to raise their awareness about the field of occupational therapy as well as about graduate studies in the field.

name: Oceanography Graduate Council
bio: OGC is an organization consisting of the graduate students in the Department of Oceanography. It gives the students a voice in the Department and College affairs while providing resources to assist students in their studies and research.

name: The Odontological Honor Society
bio: The purpose of the Odontological Honor Society is to honor D.D.S. candidates at the Texas A&M School of Dentistry for their academic success and commitment to leadership.

name: Office of Fraternity and Sorority Life
bio: The Office of Fraternity and Sorority Life is home to almost 60 values-based, Greek-letter organizations governed by one of four councils: Collegiate Panhellenic Council (CPC), the InterFraternity Council (IFC), the Multicultural Greek Council (MGC), and the National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC).

name: Office of the Commandant
bio: The Office of the Commandant at Texas A&M University oversees various student organizations and programs, including the Corps Scholarship Program and Corps Operations.

name: Old Army Gentlemen's Society
bio: Old Army Gentlemen's Society is a social, service, and leadership organization based on the premise of bringing student leaders from all aspects of campus together in both social and service settings. As gentlemen of OL' AGS, we pride ourselves on being "Aggies First, Gentlemen Always" and act according to the five pillars of the organization: Accountability, Honor, Humility, Integrity, and Passion.

name: Omega Chi Epsilon Chemical Engineering Honor Society
bio: The Texas A&M Chapter of OXE's purpose is to recognize outstanding academic achievement in the Artie McFerrin Department of Chemical Engineering. This organization aims to bring motivated students together both socially and professionally to promote student faculty interaction as well as through philanthropic endeavors.

name: Omega Delta Phi
bio: Omega Delta Phi is a service/social fraternity dedicated to the needs and concerns of the Hispanic community, promoting traditional values of Unity, Honesty, Integrity, and Leadership.

name: Omega Phi Alpha-National Service Sorority
bio: Omega Phi Alpha is a National Service Sorority founded in 1970 at Texas A&M University, focusing on service, sisterhood, and leadership development.

name: Omega Psi Phi
bio: Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc. is rooted in uniting the best-qualified men who exemplify the principles of manhood, scholarship, perseverance, and uplift with true ideals of friendship in order to service humanity.

name: On-Campus Banking Exemption Committee
bio: In recognition of the unique banking needs of some of our student organizations, the Department of Student Activities provides an On-Campus Banking Exemption process for student organizations that meet specific criteria.

name: One Army: Texas Aggie Men United
bio: One Army is a men's leadership and service organization at Texas A&M University. The mission is to develop members as Aggies and leaders, serving the campus and community, and promoting unity in Aggieland.

name: OOC Corps Operations
bio: The OOC Corps Operations at Texas A&M University focuses on providing opportunities for students to engage in service and leadership activities.

name: Operation Smile
bio: The mission and purpose is to help raise money and awareness to provide free cleft surgery that transforms a child's life. Operation Smile creates solutions that deliver safe surgery to people where it is needed most.

name: Order of Omega
bio: Order of Omega is the premier national Greek leadership honor society, recognizing the best and brightest members of Fraternity and Sorority Life. At Texas A&M, Order of Omega celebrates juniors and seniors who demonstrate exceptional leadership, service, and scholarship.

name: Orthodox Christian Campus Ministries
bio: Our mission as OCCM-A&M is to develop and maintain a relationship with our Lord Jesus Christ through prayer and worship, to reach out to the community through service and evangelism, and to grow in the bond of love through fellowship with each other in the Holy Spirit.

name: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
bio: The purpose of OCF is to provide rich community in Christ to all Orthodox Christians and any other interested students or faculty through worship, education, fellowship, witnessing, and service.

name: oSTEM at Texas A&M
bio: oSTEM (Out in STEM) is a national society of LGBTQ+ students in science, technology, engineering, mathematics and their allied fields. Our mission is to establish a community for queer Aggies, foster an environment for safe professional and social development, and connect them to progressive and queer-friendly companies and university faculty.

name: Out of State Ambassador Program
bio: The Out-of-State Ambassador Program (OOSAP) is an organization dedicated to providing a welcoming social environment for out-of-state students while serving as ambassadors for the university to potential out-of-state students.

name: Outdoor Adventures
bio: Outdoor Adventures at Texas A&M University provides the Texas A&M and B/CS community with access to the outdoors. We offer a wide range of trips and classes, a large selection of outdoor gear to rent, an indoor rock climbing facility, and other resources to get you in touch with the world around you.

name: OUTLaw
bio: OUTlaw seeks to celebrate the diversity and culture of the LGBTQ+ community, increase awareness of LGBTQ issues, assist in research, promote LGBTQ-themed courses, advocate for inclusion and equality, and provide a safe space for LGBTQ students and allies.

name: Paradigm: Forging Model Men of Aggieland
bio: Paradigm strives to mold great men of Texas A&M through the values of passion, leadership, altruism, excellence, and enrichment to act as model representatives of the Aggie Family.

name: Parsons Mounted Cavalry
bio: Parsons Mounted Cavalry (PMC) is a special unit within the Texas A&M Corps of Cadets, serving as the university’s only mounted cavalry unit. PMC upholds Aggie traditions while demonstrating horsemanship, leadership, and teamwork.

name: Partners in Health Engage A&M
bio: The mission of PIH Engage is to empower communities to advocate for and advance the right to health and social justice for all. Through grassroots organizing, education, and activism, we strive to build a world where every individual has access to high-quality healthcare, regardless of their socioeconomic background or geographical location.

name: Patriot Paws of Aggieland
bio: The purpose of Patriot Paws of Aggieland is to illustrate the support we can provide to military personnel before and after they have served through the use of service animals. Patriot Paws of Aggieland assists in the training/socialization of specifically selected dogs for our Patriot Paws headquarters in Rockwall, Texas to later be placed with disabled American veterans.

name: Percussion Studio
bio: Percussion Studio is a drum and percussion performance group at Texas A&M University, founded in 1999. The group performs a variety of percussion literature and hosts events throughout the year.

name: Persian Student Association
bio: The purpose of the association shall be to bring together the Iranian student bodies at Texas A&M University as well as other interested individuals in College Station/Bryan area through community service, cultural and social events and recreational activities and to introduce Iranian culture to the Texas A&M community.

name: Personal Finance for Dental Professionals
bio: The primary goal of this organization is to prepare future and current dental professionals for managing their finances during and beyond dental school. We plan to educate on topics including, but not limited to: budgeting, investments, retirement savings, and tax nuances.

name: Pharmacy College Organization Group
bio: The purpose of the Pharmacy College Organization Group shall be to coordinate the efforts of Texas A&M pharmacy student organizations across its College Station and Kingsville campuses and promote pharmacy practice and the role of the pharmacy student at Texas A&M through pharmacy student organizations.

name: Phi Alpha Theta
bio: To promote the study of history through the encouragement of research, good teaching, publication, and the exchange of learning and ideas among Historians.

name: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc.
bio: The purpose of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc. is to promote the development of character through participation and community service, leadership, scholarship, and brotherhood-building activities.

name: Phi Delta Theta
bio: To promote a Standard for Brotherhood by accomplishing the three Cardinal Principles of Phi Delta Theta: Friendship, Sound Learning, and Moral Rectitude.

name: Phi Eta Sigma
bio: Phi Eta Sigma encourages and rewards academic excellence among first-year students in institutes of higher learning.

name: Phi Gamma Delta
bio: Phi Gamma Delta exists to promote lasting friendships, to reaffirm high ethical standards and values, and to foster personal development in the pursuit of excellence.

name: Phi Iota Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
bio: Phi Iota Alpha Fraternity, Inc., established December 26, 1931 is the Oldest Latino Fraternity in Existence. The brotherhood is composed of undergraduate, graduate, and professional men internationally. Brothers of the organization commit themselves toward the empowerment of the Latino community by providing intensive social and cultural programs and activities geared toward the appreciation, promotion and preservation of Latin American culture.

name: Phi Lambda Upsilon
bio: The promotion of high scholarship and original investigation in all branches of pure and applied chemistry.

name: Phi Sigma Rho
bio: Phi Sigma Rho is a social sorority for women in engineering and engineering technology. Phi Rho is the largest sorority for engineers in the country and through Phi Sigma Rho, our sisters develop the highest standard of personal integrity, strive for academic excellence, and build friendships that will last a lifetime.

name: Philadelphia Sisters
bio: The foundation of Philadelphia Sisters is Jesus Christ and the desire to glorify His name. Philadelphia Sisters' goal is to form a Christian sisterhood that promotes and furthers God's global glorification.

name: Philippine Student Association
bio: To promote unity and brotherhood among Filipino students at Texas A&M University, to enhance awareness of the Filipino culture in the university, to foster goodwill and to develop a working relationship with the student body of Texas A&M, and to achieve academic excellence.

name: Philosophy Club
bio: To gather students interested in philosophy together for intellectual discussion and to learn from peers in a social setting. To give people a better understanding on how useful philosophy can be in practical matters.

name: Physical Therapy Society
typical_activities: Networking, Community service, Social events, Field trips
bio: PTS provides a place for students that are interested in physical therapy to come together and gain a better understanding of the field, undergo professional development, and become better connected with other pre-PT peers through networking, community service, social events, field trips, and hands-on experience.

name: Pi Beta Phi
bio: The Mission of Pi Beta Phi Fraternity for Women is to promote friendship, develop women of intellect and integrity, cultivate leadership potential and enrich lives through community service.

name: Pi Kappa Alpha
bio: Pi Kappa Alpha is dedicated to developing men of integrity, intellect, and high moral character and to fostering a truly lifelong fraternal experience.

name: Pi Kappa Phi
bio: To promote the development of character, leadership, achievement, service, and scholarship.

name: Pi Mu Epsilon
bio: Pi Mu Epsilon is a non-secret organization whose purpose is the promotion of scholarly activity in mathematics among students in academic institutions, and among the staffs of qualified non-academic institutions.

name: Pi Tau Sigma
bio: The purpose of our organization is to foster high ideals in the engineering profession, stimulate interest in departmental activities, promote the general welfare of its members, and prepare students for leadership roles.

name: Pink First Club
bio: Our mission is to empower women to lead informed, healthy lives by fostering awareness of breast cancer and advocating for comprehensive women’s health. We aim to provide accessible resources, knowledge, and support, focusing on early detection, preventative care, and holistic well-being.

name: Political Science Aggies
bio: The purpose and objectives of this organization shall be to further interest in the degree of Political Science. In addition, the goal of the organization is to foster a community and create fellowship amongst Aggies who plan on getting a degree in Political Science and provide a meeting ground for people interested in Political Science.

name: Poultry Science Club
bio: The purpose of this organization is to encourage and promulgate interest in Poultry Science among the students of Texas A&M University and to establish and maintain relations between our organization and members of the poultry industry. The Poultry Science Club participates in various community service activities, social events, wing-bandings, and hosts a scholarship banquet at the end of the spring semester.

name: Pre Law Society
bio: This organization serves to further interest in the field of legal study and the legal profession. This organization collaborates with the Pre-Law Advisor, who serves as the primary point of contact for the Law School Admissions Council (LSAC), law school recruiters, attorneys, and Law School Admissions Test (LSAT) preparation companies.

name: Pre-Endodontics Society
bio: Our mission is to educate and prepare interested students in the field of Endodontics. We want to help students adequately prepare for their journey in specializing in the field during their education here at the College of Dentistry, and post-graduation.

name: Pre-Orthodontics Society
bio: The TAMSOD Pre-Orthodontics Society is established for the purpose of providing information and tools to help pre-doctoral students at TAMSOD to learn more about the orthodontic specialty and prepare them to apply and receive entry into residency programs.

name: Pre-PA and Pre-Nursing at Texas A&M Higher Education Center at McAllen
bio: This student-led organization’s mission is to prepare and unite Pre-PA and Pre-Nursing students at Texas A&M McAllen to provide medical care to all people with compassion and dedication, growing patient care experience by diving deeper into how these professions provide adequate care for individuals.

name: Presente en la Lucha de Mama
bio: The purpose of this organization is to support and sponsor Latinx families with mothers who have breast cancer and/or other terminal illnesses. The support from the organization would come in the form of services such as childcare, homecooked meals, cleaning services, or any other form of care that Latinx mothers usually take care of in their households.

name: PrideSVMC
bio: Pride Student Veterinary Medical Community strives to foster a safe, supportive, and inclusive environment for veterinary students who identify as members of the LGBTQIA+ community and their allies. The organization is committed to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion within the veterinary profession through educational programming, leadership development, and community engagement.

name: Pro-Life Aggies
bio: Pro-Life Aggies is dedicated to promoting respect for and the preservation of all innocent life from fertilization to natural death. As a secular, nonpartisan organization, we work to build a culture of life at Texas A&M University through supportive services for pregnant and parenting students, activism, volunteer work, and education.

name: Product@TAMU
bio: Product@TAMU brings together students of like-minded interests in product management to create an atmosphere of continuous learning and opportunities to advance or start a career in product management.

name: Professional Association for Industrial Distribution
bio: PAID is an organization for promoting student involvement with Industrial Distribution faculty and industry personnel. Student members organize and publicize business meetings, power lunches, social events, field trips, publications, and more to provide opportunities outside the classroom to enhance career skills.

name: Professional Brotherhood of Engineers
bio: The purpose of the PBE is to create a brotherhood of engineers to thrive socially, academically, and professionally.

name: Progressively Reaching Excellence in Professionalism
bio: To prepare and develop leaders among freshmen students through teamwork, communication, planning, and delegation while placing an emphasis on preparation for future professional opportunities. Also to create a family environment of support and fun that will create long-lasting friendships and unforgettable experiences.

name: Providing Smiles and Understanding Needs (P.S.U.N)
bio: P.S.U.N. provides free programs and events to children and their families in Bryan/College Station with long term illnesses, disabilities, and special needs. We provide several outreach options for our community such as family programs, challenger sports, buddy programs, and miscellaneous events.

name: Psychology Club/ Psi Chi
bio: The Texas A&M Psychology Club is open to all students and offers the opportunity to meet other students interested in psychology, listen to professors discuss their research, and learn more about opportunities available for undergrads getting their degrees and considering grad school.

name: Psychology Department Organization of Graduate Students
bio: The purpose of PDOGS shall be to promote collaboration among graduate students in the Psychology Department at Texas A&M, and to facilitate the relationship between the Psychology Department and graduate students. The major goals of PDOGS shall be to encourage collaborative relationships and a community among graduate students, to assist open dialogue between the Psychology Department and graduate students, and to raise funds to support social and research activities to enhance collaboration among graduate students.

name: Public Health Student Leaders at Texas A&M University Higher Education Center at McAllen
bio: Our purpose is to promote community health and wellness through education, advocacy, and outreach. We aim to empower students aspiring to pursue a career in public health or healthcare, foster a supportive environment, and engage in initiatives that address public health challenges.

name: Public Health Student Organization
