bio: We look to represent the Corps of Cadets and Texas A&M by competing in the National Collegiate Club Golf Association (NCCGA). Our primary purpose is to represent the university the best we can on and off the golf course, making Texas A&M and the Corps look desirable for all students.

name: Texas A&M Corps Tennis Team
bio: The purpose of the Corps Tennis Team is to provide a fair and enjoyable opportunity to play tennis in a familiar environment with other cadets, and build a competitive team that will contribute to the reputation and interest of the University and Corps of Cadets as well as educate cadets on tennis practices and techniques.

name: Texas A&M Crew Team
bio: To encourage, support, and participate with members in the enhancement of the sport of rowing by competing at an intercollegiate level in either local and national regattas.

name: Texas A&M Cybersecurity Club
bio: The Texas A&M Cybersecurity Club offers opportunities to expand knowledge of cybersecurity topics, teach networking within the tech industry, and provide exposure to internship and full-time positions through sponsors and guest speakers.

name: Texas A&M Cycling Team
bio: To promote all forms of bicycle racing in the South Central Collegiate Cycling Conference, under the name of Texas A&M. Also to promote cycling in general and grow the sport as a whole.

name: Texas A&M Dairy Science Club
typical_majors: Animal Science, Dairy Science, Food Technology
bio: The Dairy Science Club at Texas A&M University promotes understanding of the dairy industry, offering educational opportunities through field trips and guest speakers, while emphasizing job opportunities in dairy management and business.

name: Texas A&M Ducks Unlimited
bio: The purpose of Texas A&M Chapter of Ducks Unlimited is to inform students about North American wetlands and the many important ways each person can help in preservation, restoration, and protection. Ducks Unlimited also teaches good hunting ethics, along with giving many hunters a chance to better educate themselves.

name: Texas A&M Economics Society
bio: The Texas A&M University Economics Society (T.A.M.E.S.) is an academically based organization closely incorporated with the Department of Economics, focusing on promoting social and professional economic information and networking for economics majors and any student interested in the field of economics.

name: Texas A&M Energy Research Society
bio: Texas A&M Energy Research Society, serving as the student body of Texas A&M Energy Institute, exists to work for undergraduate and graduate student researchers in the area of energy to ensure that their needs are understood, advocated, and promoted through education, research, and learning.

name: Texas A&M Engineering Academies Student Organization
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Engineering Academies Organization is to promote the professional and personal development of students who attend or transitioned from an engineering academy in pursuit of a degree within Engineering. The organization will provide academic assistance, opportunities of networking with professional contacts, mentorships, scholarships, as well as the development of leadership skills to former engineering academy students.

name: Texas A&M Eventing
bio: The Texas A&M Eventing Team exists to introduce, promote, support and educate, with the support of professionals, the sport of Eventing to members and the surrounding community.

name: Texas A&M Fencing Club
bio: The purpose is to learn the art of fencing to compete in tournaments with other universities, clubs, and nationally. We work together as a team to learn from each other and to improve physical, as well as mental skills.

name: Texas A&M Fly Fishing Club
bio: Our mission is to grow the community of fly fishing at Texas A&M through conservation, research, and community outreach.

name: Texas A&M Geographical Society
typical_activities: Networking events, Special projects, Presentations, Geography related experiences
bio: The Geography Society aims to enhance members knowledge and understanding of geography as well as creating a social and professional network between members of the society and professionals in the field.

name: Texas A&M German Club
bio: The Texas A&M German Club will work to spread the German language and German, Austrian and Swiss Culture to anyone who wants to participate. It offers gatherings, presentations, and events, where students can learn, have fun, and improve their German.

name: Texas A&M Handball Club
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Handball Club is to teach, learn, and fall in love with the sport of handball. We aim to make new friends, have fun, travel with the club, and most importantly, to help ease the stress of college life.

name: Texas A&M Health Science Center - College of Nursing Class Council
bio: To enhance the educational experience by providing opportunities for networking among students, to represent the interests of students to the administration of the School of Nursing and the HSC, to promote the nursing profession, to develop community outreach through service activities and to assist students in developing leadership skills.

name: Texas A&M Health Science Center College of Nursing Student Nurses' Association
bio: The mission and purpose of the Texas A&M Health Science Center School of Nursing Student Nurses' Association is to organize, represent, and mentor students preparing for initial licensure as registered nurses, as well as those enrolled in baccalaureate completion programs. Convey the standards and ethics of the nursing profession.

name: Texas A&M Health Science Center Rangel College of Pharmacy AMCP Student Pharmacist Chapter
bio: The mission is to promote sound managed care pharmacy principles through education and professional development of its student pharmacist members. The organization encourages education and supports the advancement of managed care pharmacy.

name: Texas A&M Health Science Center School of Nursing Round Rock Class Council
bio: The purposes of the Class Council are to enhance the educational experience by providing opportunities for networking among students, to represent the interests of students to the administration of the School of Nursing (SON), to promote the nursing profession, to develop community outreach through service activities, and to assist students in developing leadership skills.

name: Texas A&M HEARTS
bio: HEARTS is dedicated to cultivating a brotherhood of future healthcare leaders who exemplify the values of Health, Excellence, Aspiration, Resilience, Tenacity, and Service at Texas A&M University and beyond. Our mission is to empower pre-health students by fostering professional development, academic success, and meaningful engagement in the healthcare community.

name: The Texas A&M HECM Pre-Dental Association
bio: The purpose of The Texas A&M HECM Pre-Dental Association is to provide a supportive and enriching environment for students aspiring to pursue careers in dentistry. Through educational activities, professional development, and community service initiatives, we aim to cultivate a passion for dentistry and a strong foundation of knowledge, skills, and ethical principles necessary to succeed in dental school.

name: Texas A&M Historical Society
bio: The purpose of the Historical Society is to promote the study of history, interest students in history as a career, and impart an understanding of the development and purpose of principles, research, and field methodology in the historical arena.

name: Texas A&M Horsemen's Association
bio: The purpose of this organization shall be to provide a social and educational environment for those students sharing a common interest in the equine industry while promoting leadership through organizational activities and offering networking opportunities.

name: Texas A&M HOSA - Future Health Professionals
bio: The mission and purpose of the Texas A&M chapter is to promote health care careers and/or health care related careers. HOSA's goal is to encourage students to join and be actively involved in the Health Science Technology Education (HSTE) and HOSA partnership.

name: Texas A&M Ice Hockey Team
bio: To participate in collegiate ice hockey against other colleges and universities around Texas and the United States and to promote the game of ice hockey throughout Texas.

name: Texas A&M IHSA Equestrian Team
bio: As part of the Intercollegiate Horse Show Association, our team offers college riders the chance to compete regionally without the need to own a horse or have prior experience. We also offer a social membership for those who want to be part of the equestrian community in a more relaxed capacity.

name: Texas A&M Iron Spikes
bio: Texas A&M Iron Spikes is the premier social, spirit and service men's organization on campus. We have a unique brotherhood consisting of members from all walks of life and from across the country.

name: Texas A&M Judo Team
bio: Provide judo skills and instruction to members of Texas A&M University and the Bryan/College Station both at a beginner and competitive level.

name: Texas A&M Kappa Alpha Pi
bio: The Beta Alpha Chapter of Kappa Alpha Pi (KAPi) Pre-Law & Government Fraternity seeks to cultivate academic excellence, leadership, professional development, and community engagement for students pursuing careers in law, government, policy, and public service.

name: Texas A&M Maritime Academy
bio: The Texas A&M Maritime Academy is one of six maritime academies in the United States and the only academy located on the Gulf Coast. It provides an opportunity for cadets to learn how to operate and maintain an ocean-going vessel.

name: Texas A&M Meat Science and Technology Association
bio: To promote opportunities for leadership and educational development of Animal Scientists with an academic emphasis in Meat Science and Food Safety. To develop a program of activities and support competitive teams such as Meat Judging, Processed Meats, and Quiz Bowl.

name: Texas A&M Medical Student Veterans Association
bio: To serve as an information hub and resource network for Texas A&M School of Medicine military veterans. The mission of the Medical Student Veterans Association is to provide School of Medicine veterans students support, networking assistance, and advocacy.

name: Texas A&M Men's Rugby Club
bio: The mission of the Texas A&M Men's Rugby Club is to be the best rugby program in the nation, to consistently increase our presence on the national rugby stage, and to do this while building leaders of character who proudly carry the Aggie name.

name: Texas A&M Men's Soccer
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Men's Soccer team is to provide college men with the opportunity to play soccer at a competitive level and help them develop a strong work ethic.

name: Texas A&M Mock Trial
bio: The purpose of Texas A&M Mock Trial shall be to instruct undergraduate students as future law students, or those interested in such, in the type of logical reasoning, analytical skills, and communication required for law school, by preparation and competition in Mock Trial.

name: Texas A&M Moot Court
bio: Texas A&M Moot Court helps students build legal research, advocacy, and public speaking skills through competition, collaboration, and community. Members can participate in brief writing and oral advocacy competitions, which offer opportunities to apply analytical reasoning, receive feedback, and represent Texas A&M at the national level.

name: Texas A&M Motorcycle Club
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M University Motorcycle Club is to raise awareness of the motorcycling community in the Bryan/College Station, and provide riders with opportunities to meet and hang out with other motorcycle riders. We strive to bring motorcyclists together and promote safe riding as a form of sport and of transportation.

name: Texas A&M National Scholar Ambassadors (TANSA)
bio: The mission and vision of TANSA is to assist the Office of Admissions at Texas A&M University in creating a warm and welcoming student-focused experience for potential, current, and former Texas A&M National Scholars and their respective families. Throughout the year, we hold events and meetings pertaining to the recruitment and networking of potential National Scholars.

name: Texas A&M Obstacle Course Racing
bio: Training Athletes to overcome not only physical obstacles but life's obstacles, while Building Leadership and Teamwork to thrive in an environment of encouragement and accountability, holding all to the same standard which is to always work hard and never give up until you cross the finish line.

name: Texas A&M Oceanography Club
bio: TAMU Ocean is a student organization dedicated to fostering community and professional growth among those interested in marine and coastal sciences. The club provides opportunities for members to connect through social events, networking opportunities, and discussions about careers in ocean-related fields.

name: Texas A&M Off-Road
bio: Texas A&M Off-Road is dedicated to the preservation, promotion and expansion of four-wheeling opportunities for our club members and all four-wheelers everywhere.

name: Texas A&M Paranormal Society
bio: Conduct legitimate and scientific paranormal investigations. We also explore, research, and learn about anything that deals with the paranormal world.

name: Texas A&M PAWS
bio: Our mission is to raise awareness and donate to our philanthropy, International Animal Rescue, while upholding the core values of Texas A&M University. Alongside our philanthropy, we will be doing many service projects dealing with the rescuing and rehabilitating of animals around Texas.

name: Texas A&M Pickleball Club
bio: The Texas A&M Pickleball Club is dedicated to promoting and growing the sport of pickleball by providing opportunities for students of all skill levels to get involved. Our mission is to foster participation in this fast-growing sport through regular practices, tournaments, social events, and skill development clinics.

name: Texas A&M Polish Association
bio: Exposing students and faculty to Polish culture through cultural enrichment and social events.

name: Texas A&M Polo Club
bio: The Texas A&M Polo Club is dedicated to introducing and growing the sport of polo to anyone willing to try the 'Sport of Kings'. We produce winning athletes, both human and equine alike.

name: Texas A&M Pre-Medical Society
bio: To educate and advise students on undergraduate, medical school, and career options in the medical field; to serve the community through various projects done as an organization and individually; to work closely with the Office of Professional School Advising to prepare pre-medical students to be competitive applicants to medical school.

name: Texas A&M Pre-Pharmacy Society
bio: The Texas A&M Pre-Pharmacy Society exists to help interested students come together to learn more about pharmacy school, practice, and other areas within the field. During the fall, representatives from Texas and occasionally out-of-state college of pharmacy programs speak at our meetings.

name: Texas A&M Pre-Speech and Language Pathology Society
bio: The main purpose of this organization is to educate, network, and assist all prospective students who desire to pursue a career in Speech and Language Pathology. This includes information about the application process, graduate school programs, and future job opportunities.

name: Texas A&M PreDental Society
bio: The purpose shall be to associate those students planning to attend dental school with the dental field and the processes of applying to dental school.

name: Texas A&M Public Health Student Association
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Public Health Student Association shall be to encourage student participation in the affairs of the School of Public Health, the Texas A&M Health Science Center, Texas A&M University, and the local community, thus enhancing the quality and scope of graduate and undergraduate education in public health.

name: Texas A&M Quidditch
bio: The mission and purpose of this organization will be to teach members to play the sport of quidditch. Texas A&M Quidditch will provide an opportunity for members to develop as individuals through building leadership skills and providing an active, athletic environment.

name: Texas A&M Revelation Outdoors
bio: Inspiring Men to Discover Jesus through his Glorious Creation.

name: Texas A&M Rural Medicine Interest Group
bio: The Rural Medicine Interest Group's mission is to promote rural health initiatives by educating medical students on the nuances of practicing rural medicine and the impact that it can have on the wellbeing of rural communities.

name: Texas A&M Sailing Team
bio: Our purpose is to learn and/or teach the basics of sailing and to use these skills by competing in intercollegiate sailing regattas (within SEISA and Nationally). Above all, our main goal is to have fun!

name: Texas A&M School Of Dentistry ADEA
bio: The purpose of ADEA is to advance and support dental education, dental research and the dental health and education of the general public.

name: Texas A&M College of Dentistry Class of 2029
bio: The purpose and objectives of the Student Council are to represent the student body to the faculty, coordinate and address problems in laboratories and clinics, and propose improvements for the school and students. The organization also aims to boost class morale through social and wellness events.

name: Texas A&M School of Dentistry Class of 2026
bio: To set a standard of leadership, service, and communication within the TAMUSOD Class of 2026.

name: Texas A&M College of Dentistry Class of 2027
bio: TAMSOD class of 2027 strives to develop student leaders and clinicians who are committed to academic excellence, bettering the field of dentistry, and serving our respective communities.

name: Texas A&M College of Dentistry Class of 2028
bio: The Class of 2028 organization is a collection of students from the TAMSOD Class of 2028. Its purpose is to discuss changes that affect the class, provide camaraderie, and influence growth in knowledge and professionalism.

name: Texas A&M College of Dentistry Dental Hygiene Class of 2027
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M School of Dentistry Dental Hygiene Class of 2027 is to assist students in their health care professional development by providing them with leadership experience, networking, and educational opportunities. The organization also advocates and educates its members on the importance of preventative disease by promoting total optimal oral health.

name: Texas A&M Science Olympiad Society
bio: The Texas A&M Science Olympiad Society (TSOS) has a goal of promoting the growth of STEM and Science Olympiad. We plan to help run the Division C Texas State Competition annually and run our own invitational tournaments.

name: Texas A&M Secular Student Alliance
bio: The Texas A&M Secular Student Alliance provides a support network for atheists, agnostics, and secular individuals, fostering understanding through discussion and dialogue.

name: Texas A&M SEDS
bio: Texas A&M SEDS members are people interested in promoting space exploration and development. The chapter provides access to information, speakers, tours, and social events related to space.

name: Texas A&M Shotokan Karate Club
meeting_times: Sunday 5:10 PM - 6:50 PM, Wednesday 9:00 PM - 10:50 PM
bio: We are the Texas A&M University Shotokan Karate Club. Founded in 1998, we train in Shotokan karate (SKIF), a traditional style of Japanese karate. Beginners and color belts are welcome to join us any time during the semester.

name: Texas A&M Society of European Provenance Sword-fighting
bio: Texas A&M SEPS is dedicated to the teaching and preservation of the sport of Historical European Martial Arts. Members of this organization are taught HEMA in a safe and fun environment, with emphasis on the sport aspect, and frequent tournament participation.

name: Texas A&M Solar Car Racing Team
bio: Design, build, and test a solar powered racecar. Supplement engineering classroom curricula with challenging extra-curricular creativity and problem solving. Promote the university as a top contender in this collegiate competition of engineering skills.

name: Texas A&M Speech and Debate Team
bio: The premier Speech & Debate team of Texas A&M University - we offer events in IPDA, CX, and Speech. General Meetings are every Thursday, from 7-8 PM in Rudder Tower 502.

name: Texas A&M Spikeball
bio: The mission of Texas A&M Spikeball will be to allow students to compete amongst each other and compete amongst other universities in the growing sport of roundnet by hosting and joining in tournaments.

name: Texas A&M Sports Car Club
bio: The purpose of TAMSCC is to encourage ownership, operation, and appreciation of motor vehicles, especially sports cars.

name: Texas A&M Student Branch of The ASHRAE
bio: The purposes of the Texas A&M student branch are exclusively scientific and educational and include the advancement of the sciences of heating, refrigerating and air-conditioning engineering and related sciences, continuing education of the members, career guidance to students, and encouragement of scientific research.

name: Texas A&M Student Chapter of Heifer International
bio: The purpose of Texas A&M Student Chapter of Heifer International shall be to offer members training in organization and leadership, as well as to allow students in be involved with fundraising and support of a nonprofit organization.

name: Texas A&M Student Chapter of the American Meteorological Society
bio: TAMSCAMS is a student chapter of the American Meteorological Society. We provide educational and social meetings for all students of Texas A&M who are interested in meteorology, provide a forum for discussions of meteorology or other related topics of general interest, promote the ideals of Texas A&M University, and acquaint the student body and the public with the science and applications of meteorology that may appear in the workplace.

name: Texas A&M Student Chapter of the Association for Women in Mathematics
bio: The Texas A&M Student Chapter of the Association for Women in Mathematics is organized to promote increased knowledge of and greater interest in the mathematical sciences, a greater understanding of the contributions of women in the mathematical sciences, and to mentor and encourage women as they prepare for careers in the mathematical sciences.

name: Texas A&M Student Chapter of the Wildlife Disease Association
bio: The mission and purpose of this organization is that of the Wildlife Disease Association: to acquire, disseminate, and apply knowledge of the health and diseases of wild animals. Specific goals include bringing together students, researchers, veterinarians, and others working in the area of wildlife health and disease, educating students about job opportunities, and connecting students with mentors.

name: Texas A&M Student Chpt. of the American Society of Landscape Architects
bio: Texas A&M ASLA provides opportunities for aspiring landscape architects to interact with fellow students as well as professionals.

name: Texas A&M Student Section of the Structural Engineers Association of Texas
bio: SEAoT welcomes graduate and undergraduate students who are interested in structural engineering. At biweekly meetings students can attend presentations made by visiting speakers from both academia and industry.

name: Texas A&M Table Tennis Club
bio: Educate Aggies about Table Tennis and have a better understanding of one of the top major youngest racket sport, where all level of players are welcomed! Socialize with other table tennis players! Complete at against other universities at NCTTA and show our Aggie pride.

name: Texas A&M Tabletop Troupe
bio: T-Cubed is a board gaming organization at Texas A&M University that organizes weekly events for individuals to learn, play, and share their favorite tabletop games. Meetings are open to everyone, and games are provided by the organization.

name: Texas A&M Taekwondo Team
bio: The Texas A&M Taekwondo team is a nationally competitive Olympic Style Taekwondo team. We compete in sparring events across the United States. We are always looking for new members of all skill levels.

name: Texas A&M Tennis Club
bio: To provide the students and faculty of Texas A&M University with a competitive, fun, and social organization to play tennis. Texas A&M Tennis Club gives beginning, intermediate, & advanced tennis players an opportunity to improve their tennis skills through hitting, training, and match play.

name: Texas A&M Trap and Skeet
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Trap and Skeet Club is to promote shotgun shooting sports, teach gun and range safety and etiquette, and teach shotgun shooting skills. The club also supports intercollegiate competition events for those members who are interested.

name: Texas A&M Triathlon Team
bio: Our mission is to promote friendly competition and a healthy lifestyle through training and competition in the sport of triathlon.

name: Texas A&M Trombone Choir
bio: To provide trombone players from across the university/community with the opportunity to participate in a performing ensemble and to enhance their musical skills.

name: Texas A&M University Aggie Turfgrass Management Club
bio: The purpose of this organization shall be to enlighten the membership to the diverse nature of the turfgrass industry and to reveal the variety of involvement and responsibilities of the proficient turfgrass manager in a non-scholastic setting.

name: Texas A&M University Career Closet
typical_classifications: Undergrad Students, Professional Students, Graduate Students, Part-Time Students, Distance/Remote Students
bio: The Texas A&M University Career Closet, founded in 2015, collaborates with the Texas A&M Career Center and the Student Government Association to enhance the professionalism of Texas A&M students while alleviating the financial burden associated with launching a career.

name: Texas A&M University Chapter of Geo-Institute
bio: The organization promotes the profession of Civil Engineering, specifically Geotechnical Engineering. It also increases the awareness of the activities of geotechnical engineers through speakers and events.

name: Texas A&M University Chapter of SIAM
bio: To promote interdisciplinary collaboration among the graduate students of Texas A&M. To provide a platform where graduate students can practice and improve their presentation skills through mutual exchanges.

name: Texas A&M University Chapter of the Student American Veterinary Medical Association
bio: The Student American Veterinary Medical Association (SAVMA) exists to support, empower, and inspire all veterinary students in improving their lives, education, and career, along with securing a better future for our profession through collaboration with our parent organization, the American Veterinary Medical Association (AVMA). The objective of SAVMA shall be to introduce veterinary students to the concept of organized veterinary medicine, to promote, enhance and support professionalism and veterinary medical education, and to encourage the development and empowerment of students as leaders in the profession of veterinary medicine and the community as a whole.

name: Texas A&M University Class of 2026
bio: To uphold the Core Values of the university and embody the Spirit of Aggieland, while representing the Class of 2026.

name: Texas A&M University Club Swimming
bio: The mission and purpose of Texas A&M University Club Swimming (TAMUCS) has four components: To provide students of Texas A&M University the opportunity to compete in championship meets at the National level, to enable students to continue rigorous training while refining performance techniques, to create a supportive, friendly, and all-inclusive team environment at Texas A&M University that prioritizes team unity and emphasizes student excellence, and to develop Collegiate Club Swimming together with US Masters Swimming, the Southwest Swim League, and fellow collegiate teams.

name: Texas A&M University College of Veterinary Medicine Class of 2029
bio: The purpose of the TAMU CVM Officer Team of the Class of 2029 is to serve as representatives for the Texas A&M University College of Veterinary Medicine and Biomedical Sciences and to serve as ambassadors for and the voice of the student body of the CVM Class of 2029.

name: Texas A&M University College of Veterinary Medicine Class of 2028
bio: We are the Class Officer team of the Texas A&M University College of Veterinary Medicine Class of 2028. As elected officials of the DVM class, we serve our peers, faculty, and school through College and class wide events, community outreach, fundraising, and fun!

name: Texas A&M University Collegiate FFA Alumni
bio: To develop TAMU CFFAA members as business professionals by enhancing networking opportunities through participation in leadership and career development events, and academic enhancement seminars to promote career and personal success.

name: Texas A&M University Disc Golf Club
bio: To grow the sport of disc golf through casual rounds, intraclub tournaments and minis, as well as competitive tournaments against other clubs and universities.

name: Texas A&M University Emergency Care Team
bio: The Texas A&M Emergency Care Team is an all volunteer student organization that provides first aid to the A&M community by working alongside the EMTs of TAMU EMS as first responders. We educate members in the emergency care of the sick and injured.

name: Texas A&M University Empowering Connections through Honor and Outreach
bio: As a 4-year co-ed organization, we seek to enhance every student’s university experience through meaningful connections and an unwavering commitment to positive energy. We aim to provide students with multiple social opportunities where they can thrive, build relationships, and use these connections as a tool to support our campus and community through philanthropy.

name: Texas A&M University Food Science Club
bio: To serve the undergraduate and graduate students of food science in extending their classroom knowledge of food science by introducing them to food industry speakers, taking food plant tours, and networking with members of professional food organizations.

name: Texas A&M University Geology and Geophysics Society
bio: The Texas A&M University Geology and Geophysics Society seeks to promote interest and knowledge of geology and geophysics by connecting students, faculty, and industry. G&G balances social and professional interactions to provide students with occasion not only to unwind in the company of their peers, but also to discover new professional and academic opportunities in the geosciences.

name: Texas A&M University Geophysical Society
bio: The objective of this organization shall be to promote interest in, and knowledge of, the sciences of geophysics and allied sciences, and to promote friendship and cooperation among those interested in the geophysical sciences.

name: Texas A&M University Graduate Student Consulting Club
bio: This organization would be the first graduate students consulting club at TAMU. The goal of TAMUGC is to help graduate students learn more about and prepare for careers in consulting.

name: Texas A&M University Irma Lerma Rangel College of Pharmacy Student College of Clinical Pharmacy
bio: The American College of Clinical Pharmacy's purpose is to improve human health by extending the frontiers of clinical pharmacy. Through strategic initiatives, partnerships, collaborations, and alliances, ACCP provides leadership, professional development, advocacy, and resources that enable clinical pharmacists to achieve excellence in practice, research, and education.

name: Texas A&M University Kendo Kyokai
bio: The purpose of this club is to allow students, faculty, and members of the Texas A&M University community the opportunity to learn and practice Kendo: Japanese fencing. It is the training of martial arts through the use of shinai, the bamboo representation of the Japanese katana.

name: Texas A&M University Legacies
bio: Texas A&M Legacies strives to create a legacy of service and leadership through the empowerment of women both within the TAMU student body and Bryan-College Station community.

name: Texas A&M University Paintball Club
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M University Paintball Club is to establish a better understanding of the paintball sport to the general public, offer assistance to any TAMU organization in their paintball event/fundraiser, promote the integrity of the sport of paintball through responsible business partnerships, and take part in any/all events that may promote the sport of paintball or the club.

name: Texas A&M University Pistol Team
bio: To promote Olympic-style shooting sports and gun safety by participating in intercollegiate pistol competitions, holding instructive shoots open to those with university affiliation, and supporting pre-college shooting.

name: Texas A&M University Pre-Vet Society
bio: To better prepare pre-vet students for the field of veterinary medicine and the application and admissions process. To provide an opportunity to help students get into vet school; provide a supportive, social, academic, and recreational environment; act as a liaison between pre-veterinary students and the College of Vet Medicine.

name: Texas A&M University Racquetball Club
bio: The purpose and objectives of this organization shall be to increase play, raise standards, and promote Texas A&M Racquetball at both the recreational and competitive levels. The TAMU Racquetball Club strives to promote racquetball at Texas A&M University for all skill levels through clinics, demo days, tournaments, and practice.

name: Texas A&M University Robotics Team and Leadership Experience
bio: TURTLE's mission is to provide A&M engineering students a hands-on experience in the field of robotics. Each semester, teams will be challenged with a project that will culminate in a significant showcase of creativity, talent, teamwork, and innovation.

name: Texas A&M University Rocket Engine Design
bio: The Texas A&M University Rocket Engine Design Team (TAMU RED) is dedicated to the development of liquid fuel bipropellant rocket engines. Members will have the opportunity to apply their classroom education to a real-world aerospace design and manufacturing challenge.

name: Texas A&M University Running Club
bio: This organization serves as the official running club of Texas A&M University. We welcome runners of all paces and skill levels to join our set running meetup times to develop themselves physically and socially.

name: Texas A&M University SACNAS Chapter
bio: To further the work and enhance the public understanding of underrepresented minorities in science. Our mission is to promote professional growth and facilitate inclusive collaboration across diverse groups and multidisciplinary sciences.

name: Texas A&M University School of Energy & Natural Resources Group
bio: The purpose of ENRG is to promote interest regarding legal and policy issues in the fields of environment, oil, gas, renewable energy sources, water, and other minerals and natural resources; to coordinate student, faculty, and guest seminars on these issues; and to facilitate networking among students and professionals within the energy sector.

name: Texas A&M University School of Veterinary Medicine Class of 2027
typical_activities: Social events, Community service opportunities, Educational opportunities, Fundraising
bio: The purpose of the TAMU SVM Officer Team of the Class of 2027 is to serve as representatives for the Texas A&M University School of Veterinary Medicine and Biomedical Sciences. The team aims to foster community through various activities including fundraising, social events, community service opportunities, and educational opportunities.

name: Texas A&M University Singing Cadets
bio: To enhance the public relations of Texas A&M University through musical presentations as deemed appropriate by the Director and to develop disciplined leaders of character as defined by the Singing Cadet Handbook.

name: Texas A&M University Sounding Rocketry Team
bio: The purpose of the Sounding Rocketry Team is to encourage an environment of academic application to technical projects. The team will learn about different components of high-powered rockets and then participate in designing, testing, and building one in order to compete in the Intercollegiate Rocket Engineering Competition.

name: Texas A&M University Student Affiliates of School Psychology
bio: The Student Affiliates of School Psychology (SASP) strives to connect graduate students with one another as they prepare for a lifetime commitment of advocating for children and their families. This organization serves as an avenue by which students can stay abreast of current issues that impact the field of school psychology.

name: Texas A&M University Student Chapter of the Society of Petroleum Engineers
bio: Our mission as the SPE student chapter at Texas A&M University is to maintain the success and raise the standards of our students, society, and department by executing a plan that seeks to fulfill SPE's mission of developing technical knowledge and providing opportunities for students to enhance their technical and professional competence.

name: Texas A&M University Student Chapter of The Wildlife Society
bio: To serve as a technical organization for students with a genuine interest in wildlife and fisheries sciences. Society events and meetings encourage communication between members, nonmembers, and professionals to create an atmosphere where understanding of the resource management sciences can be improved.

name: Texas A&M University Women's Club Basketball Team
bio: The purpose and objectives of this organization will be to provide a competitive, structured atmosphere for Texas A&M women athletes to participate in basketball games, whether it is against other Aggies or other universities; provide an opportunity for teamwork and leadership through team play, practice, community service, and fundraisers.

name: Texas A&M University Women's Soccer Club
bio: The Texas A&M Women's Club Soccer Team is a well respected collegiate soccer club both locally and nationally. Our purpose is to provide Texas A&M students the opportunity to participate in competitive intercollegiate club soccer and to represent the university.

name: Texas A&M University Wrestling Team
bio: To promote the sport of wrestling at Texas A&M and expand the reach of collegiate wrestling in the state of Texas. For Texas A&M students to gain a higher education while also being given the opportunity to compete collegiality without the stress of NCAA competition.

name: Texas A&M Wakeboarding
bio: TAMU Wake is an organization that exists as both a club and a competitive sports team within A&M. We provide an opportunity to practice and compete in wakeboard, wake-skate, and wake-surf events at the collegiate level, as well as meet and form friendships with other enthusiasts.

name: Texas A&M Water Ski Club
bio: The Texas A&M Water Ski Club promotes interest in water skiing and its related activities among students, faculty, and staff. The team competes in three-event waterskiing and welcomes members of all skill levels.

name: Texas A&M Weightlifting
bio: The purpose of Texas A&M Weightlifting will be to educate and advance students in the classroom and on the platform nationally and internationally in the sport of Olympic Weightlifting. TAMUW will be an opportunity for students to learn both as lifters and as future coaches in Weightlifting, while working alongside like-minded individuals.

name: Texas A&M Women In Aviation
bio: Texas A&M Women In Aviation is a 3rd party affiliate of the Women In Aviation International organization. Our mission seeks to inform, empower, and equip women with the knowledge and tools to be successful in any industry, especially that of aviation.

name: Texas A&M Women's Lacrosse Club
bio: The purpose of this organization shall be to promote the sport of women's lacrosse at Texas A&M while representing the University in the Texas Women's Lacrosse League and other events across the Nation.

name: Texas A&M Women's Rugby Football Club
bio: To promote the sport of women's rugby and to teach members how to play properly and safely.

name: Texas A&M Women's Ultimate Frisbee
bio: The purpose of Texas A&M Women's Ultimate is to create and oversee events that provide a quality environment for players of all skill levels to learn and compete against other college Ultimate teams while increasing Ultimate awareness and the 'Spirit of the Game' throughout the community.

name: Texas A&M Women's Volleyball Club
bio: The Women's Volleyball Club provides a competitive atmosphere by challenging other collegiate volleyball clubs from across the nation. The club carries a 1st and 2nd team that travel mainly throughout Texas, competing during the fall and spring semesters.

name: Texas A&M Womens Water Polo
bio: The purpose of the Texas A&M Women’s Water Polo Club is to promote and grow the sport of women’s water polo within the university and surrounding community. We aim to provide a welcoming, inclusive, and competitive environment for athletes of all skill levels to develop their abilities, foster teamwork, and build lasting friendships.

name: Texas A&M Zoological Society
bio: The purpose of this organization is to educate members about zoology. Speakers and educational field trips provide information on wildlife, nature, science, research, and career opportunities working with animals.

name: Texas Aggie Airsoft
bio: We are the official Texas A&M Airsoft Organization! Founded in 2025, we are currently growing and finding our legs as an org. Our main activity is playing Airsoft at Zoomz Paintball on Saturdays.

name: Texas Aggie Bankruptcy Society
bio: The Texas Aggie Bankruptcy Society (TABS) seeks to promote bankruptcy law as a field of interest at A&M Law. The organization fosters and encourages interest in Bankruptcy as a legal field and coordinates with professional bankruptcy organizations for networking opportunities.

name: Texas Aggie CattleWomen
bio: The purpose of the Texas Aggie CattleWomen is to educate the student body and the public about the beef industry, including holding events that promote beef and provide information on its nutritional value and cultural impact.

name: Texas Aggie Democrats
bio: Texas Aggie Democrats is a recognized student organization at Texas A&M University, dedicated to the ideals of the Democratic Party. We engage in activism, campaigning, education, and much more.

name: Texas Aggie Game Developers
bio: The Texas Aggie Game Developers (TAGD) seeks to grow a tightknit community of individuals looking to further their abilities as game developers. We do this by facilitating a semester-long game jam every semester with a continually unique theme, networking with industry professionals, and providing workshops and activities that enhance practical understanding of game design.

name: Texas Aggie Yell Leaders
bio: To promote and to perpetuate all Aggie traditions and Aggie athletics and to serve as an ambassador for Texas A&M University in everything that we do.

name: Texas Aggies Fighting Alzheimer's
bio: The mission and purpose of this organization is to give a voice to Alzheimer's disease by raising Alzheimer's awareness and educating Texas A&M students on the prevalence and effects of this disease. Our organization will be about education, research awareness, and support for the Alzheimer's Association and caretakers.

name: Texas Association of Women Dentists
bio: The Texas Association of Women Dentists is a professional, social, and service organization that aims to develop relationships between future female dentists that will provide long term benefits, both personally and professionally.

name: Texas Rising Texas A&M
bio: The mission of our Texas Rising chapter centers around community organizing, issue advocacy, leadership trainings, and civic engagement. The purpose is to advocate for progressive public policies that address reproductive rights, voter suppression, climate justice, criminal injustice, and LGBT equality.

name: Texas Society of Professional Engineers Higher Education Center McAllen
bio: Our organization is dedicated to fostering a dynamic community for aspiring engineers, focused on promoting professional growth, academic excellence, and community engagement.

name: Theme Park Organization, TPO
bio: The Texas A&M Theme Park Organization (TPO) is the only Texas A&M Student Organization specializing in the theme park industry. TPO gives students access to professional network opportunities within the amusement parks industry.

name: Theta Tau
bio: The purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship. We uphold our purpose through many activities such as professional workshops and events, leadership development, community service projects, social events, competitions, and national events.

name: ThinkTank
bio: TAMU Think Tank aims to provide a platform for students to compete in real engineering crowdsourcing competitions and present to real professionals in industry-leading companies while teaching the leadership and self-discipline needed to run a completely independent team.

name: Thomistic Institute at Texas A&M
bio: The mission of the Thomistic Institute is to bring top-notch intellectuals to speak to students at Texas A&M about a variety of topics in the fields of philosophy and theology. This will bring about deeper thought about the rich Christian intellectual tradition.

name: Thrive
bio: Thrive South Asian InterVarsity seeks to provide a Christian campus ministry to South Asian students at Texas A&M University. Thrive exists to create a community where South Asian students can come together to grow spiritually and connect with one another, while also sharing their unique cultural backgrounds.

name: TLAC Graduate Student Association
bio: To assist graduate students in the Department of Teaching, Learning and Culture and to address their individual and collective concerns pertaining to their graduate experience.

name: TOMAGWA Student Run Clinic
bio: The TOMAGWA Student-Run Clinic is a collaboration between Texas A&M College of Medicine, Houston Methodist, and TOMAGWA HealthCare Ministries that serves to provide compassionate and accessible healthcare to underserved and uninsured communities in Tomball, Magnolia, and Waller, TX while offering hands-on clinical experience for medical students.

name: Traditions Council
bio: Traditions Council is a Student Government Committee dedicated to preserving and promoting the traditions of Texas A&M University through outreach and education.

name: Trailblazers
bio: The purpose of Trailblazers is to educate freshmen business students on the various types of highly sought-after careers they can pursue as well as provide them with honest perspectives on what it is like to work in and recruit for those careers.

name: Transcend
bio: Transcend exists as a community organization for the transgender, nonbinary, gender-nonconforming and gender-questioning community at Texas A&M University and the Bryan-College Station area. It serves as a support group for students and non-students to connect with allies and other trans individuals, to make friends and share experiences.

name: Treehouse (Aggie Lutherans)
bio: We are a grace-filled, Christ-centered community, welcoming to all students. Bring your doubts, your struggles, your questions along with your desire for community, realness, depth, hard conversations, and laughter.

name: Triangle
bio: The purpose of Triangle shall be to maintain a fraternity of engineers, architects, and scientists. It shall carry out its purpose by establishing chapters that develop balanced men who cultivate high moral character, foster lifelong friendships, and live their lives with integrity.

name: True Life Change
bio: The purpose of this organization is to change the lives of men and women through effective teachings of the Bible during our weekly bible studies.

name: Turkish Student Association
bio: The Turkish Student Association strives to spread the rich culture and history of Turkey to Texas A&M University and Bryan/College Station area by hosting educational and social community events.

name: Turning Point USA
bio: Turning Point USA at Texas A&M University's mission is to educate students about the importance of fiscal responsibility, free markets, and limited government through innovative campus activism and nonpartisan, thought-provoking discussion on a wide variety of political issues.

name: Twelve
bio: Twelve is a co-ed organization that hopes to give the Texas A&M community an opportunity to grow in leadership, serve the Bryan/College Station area and allow members to grow their Aggie Network through a variety of events.

name: Two42 College Ministry
bio: Two42 exists to foster community among college students while guiding them into a growing relationship with Christ.

name: Tzu Chi Collegiate Association
bio: The Tzu Chi Collegiate Association (TCCA) promotes morals, strengthens character, and exemplifies humility, respect, and elegance. The organization focuses on volunteer and community service through the four major Tzu Chi missions: charity, medicine, education, and culture.

name: Ukrainian Club
typical_activities: Social events, Fundraising events, Workshops, Concerts, Documentary screenings
bio: The Ukrainian Club is a community that values freedom, cultural diversity, and empathy. The Club raises awareness about the military invasion of Ukraine and presents its rich culture, history, and creativity.

name: Ultimate Frisbee Sports Club
bio: To play Ultimate every week, and to represent Texas A&M at collegiate Ultimate Frisbee tournaments around Texas and the US.

name: Underwood Community Council
bio: The Harrington–Underwood Community Council represents the residents of Harrington and Underwood Halls at Texas A&M University. The council is committed to building a supportive and engaging residential environment through programming, student advocacy, and hall pride.

name: UNICEF at TAMU
bio: TAMU UNICEF is a campus representative of UNICEF USA, working to help children through fundraising, advocacy, and education.

name: United Campus Ministry in Aggieland
bio: UCM is an open and affirming authentic Christian community with a passion for the prophet Micah's call to "do justice, love kindness, and walk humbly with God." Join us for opportunities to grow spiritually, engage in social justice, and discover how our God-given talents can work toward systemic change and making the world a better place for all.

name: University Center & Special Events
bio: University Center & Special Events, a department within the Division of Student Affairs, manages various facilities and provides professional services including event coordination, setup, equipment rentals, AV services, and event staffing.

name: University Wind Symphony
bio: The University Wind Symphony aims to teach students about music written for the wind band, music theory, sight reading, and the historical background of composers while representing Texas A&M University in a professional manner at performances.

name: Uplifting Recreation In Tag
bio: Uplifting Recreation In Tag (UR IT) is an organization created to improve the physical and mental health of Texas A&M students by providing Aggies with the opportunity to play tag. All Aggies are welcome to be Taggies with us.

name: Valley Alliance of Mentors for Opportunities & Scholars at Texas A&M University
bio: The mission and purpose of the Organization is to assist VAMOS scholarship recipients in completing a post-secondary education through mentoring and the promotion of ethical and social development.

name: Valor
bio: The purpose of Valor is to raise up a generation of ROTC cadet and veteran leaders to change the world, one life at a time. The student-led movement seeks to introduce students in ROTC and student-veterans to Christ, help them to grow in faith, and inspire commitment to advancing the purposes of God in the world.

name: VAW Global Alliances - Veterinary Outreach Texas A&M
bio: VAW- Veterinary Outreach provides interns with an opportunity to work first hand with experienced local veterinarians in some of the most poverty-stricken communities. Interns will fundraise for medications and supplies prior to the trip abroad.

name: VAW Global Health Alliances Medical Chapter
bio: We are a non-governmental global health and development organization established for the purpose of cultivating long term sustainable and equitable partnerships with local communities and professionals through support and capacity building for essential and accessible health services.

name: Venezuelan Student Association
bio: To encourage and promote the professional, academic and cultural growth of its members. To promote the Venezuelan culture at the Texas A&M System through various cultural events. To serve as a connection point for Venezuelan students in Texas A&M.

name: Vertical Flight Society
bio: The Vertical Flight Society is a professional society with two core aspects of its mission: to spread enthusiasm and increase awareness about Vertical Flight through biweekly events and to house and support the national award-winning TAMU Vertical Flight Design Team.

name: Veterinarians Without Borders
bio: The primary mission of this chapter will be to provide veterinary exposure to Texas A&M students through international trips, local volunteering opportunities, and veterinarian speakers. Such volunteer activities will promote animal welfare within the Bryan/ College Station area, while exemplifying the Aggie value of Selfless Service.

name: Veterinary Business Management Association
bio: The Veterinary Business Management Association is a student-driven organization dedicated to advancing the profession through increasing business knowledge, creating networking opportunities, and empowering students to achieve their personal and professional goals.

name: Veterinary Imaging Club
bio: The Veterinary Imaging Club seeks to provide members with significant learning opportunities in veterinary medicine utilizing imaging modalities such as radiology, fluoroscopy, ultrasonography, MRI, CT, and nuclear scintigraphy.

name: Office of the Vice President for Student Affairs
bio: The Office of the Vice President for Student Affairs (OVPSA) serves and supports 14 different departments within the Division of Student Affairs that are critically engaged in all aspects of students’ lives and the delivery of key services and support.

name: VIDA Volunteer
bio: Texas A&M Vida Volunteer is a non-profit humanitarian volunteer organization whose mission is to provide quality healthcare to underserved communities while providing volunteers with a life-changing experience. The organization recruits student volunteers and medical professionals to perform medical, dental, and veterinary brigades in Central America.

name: Vietnamese Student Association
bio: Our objective is to unite the students who want to spread the Vietnamese culture and also have the desire to learn about it. We want to provide a doorway for the Texas A&M community to the customs and legacy of the Vietnamese people.

name: Voices of Praise Gospel Choir
bio: To be a visual entity of God on the campus of Texas A&M University that ministers to the physical, emotional, and spiritual needs of all God's children and provide an avenue by which believers freely praise and worship the Lord.

name: The VOOM Ambassadors
bio: The VOOM Ambassador's mission is to voice, engage, and serve the VOOM Foundation as advocates of the organization. We will drive them to their goal of providing impartial sustainable healthcare programs dedicated to quality, with a particular interest in supporting the underprivileged and underserved.

name: Warrior Training Battalion
bio: The purpose of Texas A&M Army ROTC is to produce and train future Army Officers of character.

name: Wesley Foundation
typical_activities: Worship, Bible study, service, social events
bio: The Texas A&M Wesley Foundation is a ministry of the United Methodist Church that welcomes all students into Christian discipleship in the Wesleyan tradition. At Wesley, you can find a community that supports you in faith, friendships, and all that life brings.

name: African Graduate Students Association
bio: Our organization aims to assist West African graduate students in adapting and integrating into the educational and social systems of Texas A&M University by providing resources, networking opportunities, and support.

name: White Creek Community Council
bio: At White Creek Apartments, we embrace the uniqueness of our community—set apart from traditional dorms by both location and lifestyle. Our Community Council is dedicated to bridging that gap by fostering a strong, open, and engaging environment for all residents.

name: Wilderness Medicine Interest Group
bio: The purpose of the Wilderness Medicine Interest Group is to encourage the interest and education of members in wilderness medicine topics.

name: Women Helping Out Other People
bio: To make a difference by serving others, with an emphasis on Campus, Children & Youth, Diversity, Elderly, and Special Needs service.

name: Women in Animation
bio: WIA is the only organization dedicated to advancing women in the field of animation. We envision a world where women share equally in the creation, production and rewards of animation.

name: Women in Economics
bio: Women in Economics seeks to provide women in the Economics department at Texas A&M University with a community through which they can expand their knowledge of economics, explore areas of interest, and broaden interpersonal skills for the purpose of professional development.

name: Women in Geosciences
bio: Women in Geosciences seeks to promote the diversity, inclusion, leadership and personal development of women in the field of geosciences at Texas A&M University.

name: Women in IEEE
bio: To be the voice of women studying Electrical and Computer Engineering at Texas A&M University. To establish a platform where concerns can be raised and conveyed through appropriate channels. To foster a sense of community among women engineers.

name: Women in Industrial & Systems Engineering
bio: Our mission is to support and empower women and underrepresented individuals in industrial and systems engineering to excel in both their professional and personal lives. We are committed to offering mentorship, leadership and skill development, and networking opportunities to prepare the next generation of leaders in this field.

name: Women in Information Systems and Excellence
bio: Women in Information Systems and Excellence (WISE) has a mission to foster growth, build a strong community, and prepare women in the information systems field for a successful and inspiring future.

name: Women in Materials Science
bio: To encourage communication between students currently studying materials science and those eager to learn what materials science and engineering is. Our goal is to retain current students as well as actively encourage new students to join our department and organization.

name: Women in Mechanical Engineering
bio: Fostering a community of women in the mechanical engineering field while educating participants on the benefits of such a degree.

name: Women In Nuclear
bio: The Texas A&M Chapter of Women in Nuclear is part of an extensive national organization that focuses on supporting an environment in nuclear energy and nuclear technologies in which women and men can succeed, providing a network for professional development, and informing the public about nuclear energy and technologies.

name: Women in Public Service
bio: The mission of Women in Public Service is to provide support and resources for women aspiring to and who have careers in government and public service. We seek to inspire excellence and confidence in members and to pursue the noble calling of a career in public service.

name: Women in Robotics, Engineering, and Development
bio: Women in Robotics, Engineering, and Development (WIRED) is a student-led effort to create opportunities for students to participate in hands-on projects and develop leadership skills. WIRED's objective is to engage students who share the goal of supporting the advancement of women in engineering majors, academic careers, and the workforce while providing opportunities to participate in engineering activities.

name: Women in Science and Engineering
bio: The mission of WISE is to promote the involvement of women in the fields of science, engineering, and technology. We aim to stimulate and encourage young women to pursue such careers as well as act as a support system for those that are currently pursuing professional degrees.

name: Women Law Students Association
bio: WLSA is an organization created to establish an environment of support for the unique challenges that women face in law. Open to all students, WLSA aims to invite future members of the legal profession to our meetings to hear insight from practicing attorneys, as well as foster additional scholarship and networking opportunities for our members.

name: Women of Color Collective Law Students Association
bio: The Women of Color Collective Law Students Association is dedicated to educating and empowering women of color and promoting their representation in the legal profession and community. The organization creates a supportive community, promotes professional development, and provides a platform to discuss issues pertinent to women of color in the law.

name: Women, Peace, and Security
bio: The WPS Student Organization is dedicated to UN Resolution 1325 and hosts speaker events, volunteering opportunities, and social engagements to highlight how factors typically excluded from security studies like gender impact security and intelligence operations.

name: Wreckin' Raas
bio: Established in 2009, Wreckin' Raas is Texas A&M's premiere, nationally-competing garba-raas dance team. We seek to continuously better ourselves, represent A&M on the national scale, and spread awareness of our Indian culture through our unique dance style.

name: Young Americans for Freedom
bio: Young America's Foundation is committed to ensuring that increasing numbers of young Americans understand and are inspired by the ideas of individual freedom, a strong national defense, free enterprise, and traditional values. The organization promotes these principles through conferences, seminars, educational materials, internships, and speakers.

name: Young Democratic Socialists of America
bio: The Young Democratic Socialists of America is the student-driven section of the Democratic Socialists of America (DSA). TAMU YDSA is focused on building a progressive movement within Bryan and College Station through local electoral and campaign work, advocating for structural change, working with ally student and community organizations, and educational socials.

name: Young Life Leadership Training
bio: The purpose of this organization shall be to present Jesus Christ to the students of Texas A&M and to train interested students for leadership in its work with high school, middle school, or special needs students.

name: Young Women for America
bio: Young Women for America is committed to promoting Biblical values and conservative principles. YWA applies Biblical principles to public policy issues, and its purpose is to equip young women to be leaders in their community and country.

name: Youth Moving Forward
bio: Youth Moving Forward (Y.M.F., YMF) exists to break the cycle of juvenile justice involvement in Brazos County through mentorship, free counseling services, and workforce training.

name: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated
bio: The Pi Omicron Chapter at Texas A&M, chartered on December 4, 1993, brings this rich legacy to the university, promoting principles of Scholarship, Service, Sisterhood, and Finer Womanhood.

name: Zeta Tau Alpha
bio: The purpose of Zeta Tau Alpha is to intensify friendship, promote happiness among its members, to perform such deeds, and to mould such opinions as will conduce to the building up of a purer and nobler womanhood in the world. ZTA's open motto is 'Seek the Noblest.'

name: ZIPS
bio: Xi Psi Phi is an honorable institution embodying three cardinal principles: Friendship, Knowledge, and Morality. Our members are taught to practice a system of moral philosophy, which is founded upon the duty of doing good to humanity.

name: Zoo, Exotics, and Wildlife Club
bio: The mission of ZEW Club shall be to offer members training in handling and medical procedures with regards to all non-domestic species, as well as to broaden the students' comprehension of the anatomical differences in non-domestic species and how their medical management and diseases compares and contrasts to domestic animals.
